[Harry Potter]91-harry and [the Sorcerer]362-the sorcerer 's Stone

CHAPTER ONE

[THE BOY WHO LIVED

[Mr.]363-mr. and [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley , of number four , [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]92-mr. dursley , were proud to say that [they]364-they were perfectly normal , thank [you]365-you very much . [They]364-they were [the last people [you]365-you 'd expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious]366-the last people you 'd expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious , because [they]364-they just did n't hold with such nonsense .

[Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley was [the director of [a firm called Grunnings]368-a firm called grunnings]367-the director of a firm called grunnings , which made drills . [He]92-mr. dursley was [a big , beefy man]369-a big , beefy man with hardly any neck , although [he]92-mr. dursley did have a very large mustache . [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley was thin and blonde and had nearly twice the usual amount of neck , which came in very useful as [she]370-she spent so much of [her]370-she time craning over garden fences , spying on [the neighbors]371-the neighbors . [The Dursleys]93-the dursleys had [a small son]372-a small son called [Dudley]94-dudley and in [their]93-the dursleys opinion there was [no finer boy]373-no finer boy anywhere .

[The Dursleys]93-the dursleys had everything [they]93-the dursleys wanted , but [they]93-the dursleys also had a secret , and [their]93-the dursleys greatest fear was that [somebody]374-somebody would discover it . [They]93-the dursleys did n't think [they]93-the dursleys could bear it if [anyone]375-anyone found out about [the Potters]376-the potters . [Mrs. Potter]95-mrs. potter was [[Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley 's sister]377-mrs. dursley 's sister , but [they]378-they had n't met for several years ; in fact , [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley pretended [she]95-mrs. potter did n't have [a sister]379-a sister , because [[her]95-mrs. potter sister]380-her sister and [[her]95-mrs. potter good - for - nothing husband]381-her good - for - nothing husband were as unDursleyish as it was possible to be . [The Dursleys]93-the dursleys shuddered to think what [the neighbors]371-the neighbors would say if [the Potters]96-the potters arrived in [the street]383-the street . [The Dursleys]93-the dursleys knew that [the Potters]96-the potters had [a small son]372-a small son , too , but [they]93-the dursleys had never even seen [him]372-a small son . [This boy]385-this boy was another good reason for keeping [the Potters]96-the potters away ; [they]93-the dursleys did n't want [Dudley]94-dudley mixing with [a child]386-a child like that .

When [Mr.]387-mr. and [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley woke up on the dull , gray Tuesday [our]388-our story starts , there was nothing about the cloudy sky outside to suggest that strange and mysterious things would soon be happening all over [the country]389-the country . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley hummed as [he]92-mr. dursley picked out [his]92-mr. dursley most boring tie for work , and [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley gossiped away happily as [she]390-she wrestled a screaming [Dudley]94-dudley into [his]92-mr. dursley high chair .

[None of [them]392-them]391-none of them noticed a large , tawny owl flutter past the window .

At half past eight , [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley picked up [his]92-mr. dursley briefcase , pecked [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley on the cheek , and tried to kiss [Dudley]94-dudley good - bye but missed , because [Dudley]94-dudley was now having a tantrum and throwing [his]94-dudley cereal at the walls . " [Little tyke]97-little tyke , "[92-mr. dursley] chortled [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley as [he]92-mr. dursley left [the house]393-the house . [He]92-mr. dursley got into [[his]92-mr. dursley car]394-his car and backed out of [number four 's drive]395-number four 's drive .

It was on the corner of [the street]383-the street that [he]92-mr. dursley noticed the first sign of something peculiar -- a cat reading a map . For a second , [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley did n't realize what [he]92-mr. dursley had seen -- then [he]92-mr. dursley jerked [his]92-mr. dursley head around to look again . There was a tabby cat standing on [the corner of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]397-the corner of privet drive , but there was n't a map in sight . What could [he]92-mr. dursley have been thinking of ? It must have been a trick of the light . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley blinked and stared at the cat . [It]398-it stared back . As [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley drove around the corner and up [the road]399-the road , [he]92-mr. dursley watched the cat in [his]92-mr. dursley mirror . [It]398-it was now reading the sign that said [Privet Drive]1-privet drive -- no , looking at the sign ; cats could n't read maps or signs . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley gave [himself]92-mr. dursley a little shake and put the cat out of [his]92-mr. dursley mind . As [he]92-mr. dursley drove toward [town]400-town [he]92-mr. dursley thought of nothing except a large order of drills [he]92-mr. dursley was hoping to get that day .

But on [the edge of [town]400-town]401-the edge of town , drills were driven out of [his]92-mr. dursley mind by something else . As [he]92-mr. dursley sat in the usual morning traffic jam , [he]92-mr. dursley could n't help noticing that there seemed to be a lot of [strangely dressed people]403-strangely dressed people about . [People in cloaks]404-people in cloaks . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley could n't bear [people who dressed in funny clothes]405-people who dressed in funny clothes -- the getups [you]406-you saw on [young people]407-young people ! [He]92-mr. dursley supposed this was some stupid new fashion . [He]92-mr. dursley drummed [his]92-mr. dursley fingers on the steering wheel and [his]92-mr. dursley eyes fell on a huddle of [these weirdos standing quite close by]408-these weirdos standing quite close by . [They]408-these weirdos standing quite close by were whispering excitedly together . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley was enraged to see that [a couple of [them]408-these weirdos standing quite close by]409-a couple of them were n't young at all ; why , [that man]410-that man had to be older than [he]410-that man was , and wearing an emerald - green cloak ! The nerve of [him]410-that man ! But then it struck [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley that this was probably some silly stunt -- [these people]411-these people were obviously collecting for something ... yes , that would be it . The traffic moved on and a few minutes later , [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley arrived in [the Grunnings parking lot]412-the grunnings parking lot , [his]92-mr. dursley mind back on drills .

[Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley always sat with [his]92-mr. dursley back to the window in [[his]92-mr. dursley office on [the ninth floor]414-the ninth floor]413-his office on the ninth floor . If [he]92-mr. dursley had n't , [he]92-mr. dursley might have found it harder to concentrate on drills that morning . [He]92-mr. dursley did n't see the owls swoop ing past in broad daylight , though [people down in [the street]383-the street]415-people down in the street did ; [they]415-people down in the street pointed and gazed open- mouthed as owl after owl sped overhead . [Most of [them]415-people down in the street]417-most of them had never seen an owl even at nighttime . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley , however , had a perfectly normal , owl - free morning . [He]92-mr. dursley yelled at [five different people]418-five different people . [He]92-mr. dursley made several important telephone calls and shouted a bit more . [He]92-mr. dursley was in a very good mood until lunchtime , when [he]92-mr. dursley thought [he]92-mr. dursley 'd stretch [his]92-mr. dursley legs and walk across [the road]399-the road to buy [himself]92-mr. dursley a bun from [the bakery]420-the bakery .

[He]92-mr. dursley 'd forgotten all about [the people in cloaks]421-the people in cloaks until [he]92-mr. dursley passed [a group of [them]421-the people in cloaks next to [the baker]423-the baker 's]422-a group of them next to the baker 's . [He]92-mr. dursley eyed [them]422-a group of them next to the baker 's angrily as [he]92-mr. dursley passed . [He]92-mr. dursley did n't know why , but [they]422-a group of them next to the baker 's made [him]92-mr. dursley uneasy . [This bunch]424-this bunch were whispering excitedly , too , and [he]92-mr. dursley could n't see a single collecting tin . [It]425-it was on [his]92-mr. dursley way back past [them]422-a group of them next to the baker 's , clutching a large doughnut in a bag , that [he]92-mr. dursley caught a few words of what [they]422-a group of them next to the baker 's were saying .

" [The Potters]96-the potters , that 's right , that 's what [I]422-a group of them next to the baker 's heard yes , [[their]96-the potters son]2348-their son , [Harry]91-harry "[422-a group of them next to the baker 's]

[Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley stopped dead . Fear flooded [him]92-mr. dursley . [He]92-mr. dursley looked back at [the whisperers]426-the whisperers as if [he]92-mr. dursley wanted to say something to [them]426-the whisperers , but thought better of it .

[He]92-mr. dursley dashed back across [the road]399-the road , hurried up to [[his]92-mr. dursley office]428-his office , snapped at [[his]92-mr. dursley secretary]429-his secretary not to disturb [him]92-mr. dursley , seized [his]92-mr. dursley telephone , and had almost finished dialing [[his]92-mr. dursley home]430-his home number when [he]92-mr. dursley changed [his]92-mr. dursley mind . [He]92-mr. dursley put the receiver back down and stroked [his]92-mr. dursley mustache , thinking ... no , [he]92-mr. dursley was being stupid . [Potter]91-harry was n't such an unusual name . [He]92-mr. dursley was sure there were [lots of people called [Potter]91-harry who had [a son]432-a son called [Harry]91-harry]431-lots of people called potter who had a son called harry . Come to think of it , [he]92-mr. dursley was n't even sure [[his]92-mr. dursley nephew]433-his nephew was called [Harry]91-harry . [He]92-mr. dursley 'd never even seen [the boy]434-the boy . It might have been [Harvey . Or Harold]98-harvey . or harold . There was no point in worrying [Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley ; [she]435-her always got so upset at any mention of [[her]435-her sister]380-her sister . [He]92-mr. dursley did n't blame [her]435-her -- if [he]92-mr. dursley 'd had [a sister like that]437-a sister like that ... but all the same , [those people in cloaks]438-those people in cloaks ...

[He]92-mr. dursley found it a lot harder to concentrate on drills that afternoon and when [he]92-mr. dursley left [the building]439-the building at five o'clock , [he]92-mr. dursley was still so worried that [he]92-mr. dursley walked straight into [someone just outside the door]440-someone just outside the door .

" Sorry , "[92-mr. dursley] [he]92-mr. dursley grunted , as [the tiny old man]441-the tiny old man stumbled and almost fell . It was a few seconds before [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley realized that [the man]442-the man was wearing a violet cloak . [He]442-the man did n't seem at all upset at being almost knocked to the ground . On the contrary , [his]442-the man face split into a wide smile and [he]442-the man said in a squeaky voice that made [passersby]443-passersby stare , " Do n't be sorry , [[my]442-the man dear sir]2349-my dear sir , for nothing could upset [me]442-the man today ! Rejoice , for [You]92-mr. dursley - Know - Who has gone at last ! Even Muggles like [yourself]92-mr. dursley should be celebrating , this happy , happy day ! "[442-the man]

And [the old man]444-the old man hugged [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley around the middle and walked off .

[Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley stood rooted to the spot . [He]92-mr. dursley had been hugged by [a complete stranger]445-a complete stranger . [He]92-mr. dursley also thought [he]92-mr. dursley had been called [a Muggle]446-a muggle , whatever that was . [He]92-mr. dursley was rattled . [He]92-mr. dursley hurried to [[his]92-mr. dursley car]394-his car and set off for [home]448-home , hoping [he]92-mr. dursley was imagining things , which [he]92-mr. dursley had never hoped before , because [he]92-mr. dursley did n't approve of imagination .

As [he]92-mr. dursley pulled into [the driveway of number four]449-the driveway of number four , the first thing [he]92-mr. dursley saw -- and it did n't improve [his]92-mr. dursley mood -- was the tabby cat [he]92-mr. dursley 'd spotted that morning . It was now sitting on [his]92-mr. dursley garden wall . [He]92-mr. dursley was sure it was the same one ; it had the same markings around its eyes .

" Shoo ! "[92-mr. dursley] said [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley loudly . The cat did n't move . [It]450-it just gave [him]92-mr. dursley a stern look . Was this normal cat behavior ? [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley wondered . Trying to pull [himself]92-mr. dursley together , [he]92-mr. dursley let [himself]92-mr. dursley into [the house]393-the house . [He]92-mr. dursley was still determined not to mention anything to [[his]92-mr. dursley wife]452-his wife .

[Mrs. Dursley]92-mr. dursley had had a nice , normal day . [She]452-his wife told [him]92-mr. dursley over dinner all about [Mrs. Next Door]99-mrs. next door 's problems with [[her]452-his wife daughter]453-her daughter and how [Dudley]94-dudley had learned a new word ( " Wo n't ! "[452-his wife] ) . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley tried to act normally . When [Dudley]94-dudley had been put to bed , [he]92-mr. dursley went into [the living room]454-the living room in time to catch the last report on the evening news :

" And finally , [bird - watchers]2350-bird - watchers everywhere have reported that [the nation]2351-the nation 's owls have been behaving very unusually today . Although owls normally hunt at night and are hardly ever seen in daylight , there have been hundreds of sightings of these birds flying in every direction since sunrise . [Experts]2352-experts are unable to explain why the owls have suddenly changed [their]2350-bird - watchers sleeping pattern . "[455-the newscaster] [The newscaster]455-the newscaster allowed [himself]455-the newscaster a grin . " Most mysterious . And now , over to [Jim McGuffin]100-jim mcguffin with the weather . [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley might have been drifting into an uneasy sleep , but the cat on the wall outside was showing no sign of sleepiness . [It]468-it was sitting as still as a statue , its eyes fixed unblinkingly on the far corner of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive . It did n't so much as quiver when a car door slammed on [the next street]469-the next street , nor when two owls swooped overhead . In fact , it was nearly midnight before the cat moved at all .

[A man]470-a man appeared on the corner the cat had been watching , appeared so suddenly and silently [you]471-you 'd have thought [he]470-a man 'd just popped out of the ground . The cat 's tail twitched and its eyes narrowed .

Nothing like [this man]472-this man had ever been seen on [Privet Drive]1-privet drive . [He]472-this man was tall , thin , and very old , judging by the silver of [his]472-this man hair and beard , which were both long enough to tuck into [his]472-this man belt . [He]472-this man was wearing long robes , a purple cloak that swept the ground , and high - heeled , buckled boots . [His]472-this man blue eyes were light , bright , and sparkling behind half - moon spectacles and [his]472-this man nose was very long and crooked , as though it had been broken at least twice . [This man]472-this man 's name was [Albus Dumbledore]104-dumbledore .

[Albus Dumbledore]104-dumbledore did n't seem to realize that [he]104-dumbledore had just arrived in [a street where everything from [his]104-dumbledore name to [his]104-dumbledore boots was unwelcome]474-a street where everything from his name to his boots was unwelcome . [He]104-dumbledore found what [he]104-dumbledore was looking for in [his]104-dumbledore inside pocket . It seemed to be a silver cigarette lighter . [He]104-dumbledore flicked it open , held it up in the air , and clicked it . The nearest street lamp went out with a little pop . [He]104-dumbledore clicked it again -- the next lamp flickered into darkness . A low rumbling sound had broken the silence around [them]489-them . If [the motorcycle]493-the motorcycle was huge , it was nothing to [the man sitting astride it]494-the man sitting astride it . [He]281-hagrid was almost twice as tall as [a normal man]495-a normal man and at least five times as wide . [He]281-hagrid looked simply too big to be allowed , and so wild - long tangles of bushy black hair and beard hid most of [his]281-hagrid face , [he]281-hagrid had hands the size of trash can lids , and [his]281-hagrid feet in [their]496-their leather boots were like baby dolphins . In [his]281-hagrid vast , muscular arms [he]281-hagrid was holding a bundle of blankets .

" [Hagrid]281-hagrid , "[104-dumbledore] said [Dumbledore]104-dumbledore , sounding relieved . " At last . And where did [you]281-hagrid get [that motorcycle]2406-that motorcycle ? "[104-dumbledore]

" Yeah , "[281-hagrid] said [Hagrid]281-hagrid in a very muffled voice , " [I]281-hagrid 'll be takin ' Sirius [[his]105-harry bike]2414-his bike back . [G'night]117-g'night , [Professor McGonagall]105-harry -- [Professor Dumbledore]114-dumbledore , [sir]2407-sir . "[281-hagrid]

" Good luck , [Harry]105-harry , "[114-dumbledore] [he]114-dumbledore murmured . [He]114-dumbledore turned on [his]114-dumbledore heel and with a swish of [his]114-dumbledore cloak , [he]114-dumbledore was gone .

A breeze ruffled the neat hedges of [Privet Drive]1-privet drive , which lay silent and tidy under the inky sky , the very last place [you]512-you would expect astonishing things to happen . [Harry Potter]91-harry rolled over inside [his]91-harry blankets without waking up . "[515-people meeting in secret all over the country]

CHAPTER TWO

THE VANISHING GLASS

Nearly ten years had passed since [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys had woken up to find [[their]93-the dursleys nephew]517-their nephew on the front step , but [Privet Drive]1-privet drive had hardly changed at all . The sun rose on [the same tidy front gardens]518-the same tidy front gardens and lit up the brass number four on [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys ' front door ; it crept into [[their]93-the dursleys living room]519-their living room , which was almost exactly the same as it had been on the night when [Mr. Dursley]92-mr. dursley had seen that fateful news report about the owls . Only the photographs on the mantelpiece really showed how much time had passed . Ten years ago , there had been lots of pictures of what looked like [a large pink beach ball wearing different - colored bonnets]520-a large pink beach ball wearing different - colored bonnets -- but [Dudley Dursley]94-dudley was no longer [a baby]521-a baby , and now the photographs showed [a large blond boy riding [his]94-dudley first bicycle , on a carousel at the fair , playing a computer game with [[his]94-dudley father]523-his father , being hugged and kissed by [[his]94-dudley mother]2393-his mother]522-a large blond boy riding his first bicycle , on a carousel at the fair , playing a computer game with his father , being hugged and kissed by his mother . [The room]525-the room held no sign at all that [another boy]526-another boy lived in [the house]393-the house , too .

Yet [Harry Potter]91-harry was still there , asleep at the moment , but not for long . [His]91-harry Aunt [Petunia]102-aunt petunia was awake and it was [her]102-aunt petunia shrill voice that made the first noise of the day .

" Up ! Get up ! Now ! "[102-aunt petunia]

[Harry]91-harry woke with a start . [[His]91-harry aunt]2384-his aunt rapped on the door again .

" Up ! "[2384-his aunt] [she]2384-his aunt screeched . [Harry]91-harry heard [her]2384-his aunt walking toward [the kitchen]529-the kitchen and then the sound of the frying pan being put on the stove . [He]91-harry rolled onto [his]91-harry back and tried to remember the dream [he]91-harry had been having . It had been a good one . There had been [a flying motorcycle]530-a flying motorcycle in it . [He]91-harry had a funny feeling [he]91-harry 'd had the same dream before .

[[His]91-harry aunt]2384-his aunt was back outside the door .

" Are [you]91-harry up yet ? "[2384-his aunt] [she]2384-his aunt demanded .

" Nearly , "[91-harry] said [Harry]91-harry .

" Well , get a move on , [I]2384-his aunt want [you]2384-his aunt to look after the bacon . And do n't [you]2384-his aunt dare let it burn , [I]2384-his aunt want everything perfect on [Duddy]94-dudley 's birthday . "[2384-his aunt]

[Harry]91-harry groaned .

" What did [you]91-harry say ? "[2384-his aunt] [[his]91-harry aunt]2384-his aunt snapped through the door .

" Nothing , nothing ... "[2384-his aunt]

[Dudley]94-dudley 's birthday -- how could [he]91-harry have forgotten ? [Harry]91-harry got slowly out of bed and started looking for socks . [He]91-harry found a pair under [his]91-harry bed and , after pulling a spider off one of them , put them on . [Harry]91-harry was used to spiders , because the cupboard under the stairs was full of them , and that was where [he]91-harry slept .

When [he]91-harry was dressed [he]91-harry went down [the hall]533-the hall into [the kitchen]529-the kitchen . The table was almost hidden beneath all [Dudley]94-dudley 's birthday presents . It looked as though [Dudley]94-dudley had gotten the new computer [he]94-dudley wanted , not to mention the second television and the racing bike . Exactly why [Dudley]94-dudley wanted [a racing bike]535-a racing bike was a mystery to [Harry]91-harry , as [Dudley]94-dudley was very fat and hated exercise -- unless of course it involved punching [somebody]374-somebody . [Dudley]94-dudley 's favorite punching bag was [Harry]91-harry , but [he]91-harry could n't often catch [him]94-dudley . [Harry]91-harry did n't look it , but [he]91-harry was very fast .

Perhaps it had something to do with living in a dark cupboard , but [Harry]91-harry had always been small and skinny for [his]91-harry age . [He]91-harry looked even smaller and skinnier than [he]91-harry really was because all [he]91-harry had to wear were old clothes of [Dudley]94-dudley 's , and [Dudley]94-dudley was about four times bigger than [he]91-harry was . [Harry]91-harry had a thin face , knobbly knees , black hair , and bright green eyes . [He]91-harry wore round glasses held together with a lot of Scotch tape because of all the times [Dudley]94-dudley had punched [him]91-harry on the nose . The only thing [Harry]91-harry liked about [his]91-harry own appearance was a very thin scar on [his]91-harry forehead that was shaped like a bolt of lightning . [He]91-harry had had it as long as [he]91-harry could remember , and the first question [he]91-harry could ever remember asking [his]91-harry Aunt [Petunia]102-aunt petunia was how [he]91-harry had gotten it .

" In the car crash when [[your]91-harry parents]2417-your parents died , "[102-aunt petunia] [she]102-aunt petunia had said . " And do n't ask questions . "[102-aunt petunia]

Do n't ask questions -- that was the first rule for a quiet life with [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys .

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon entered [the kitchen]529-the kitchen as [Harry]91-harry was turning over the bacon .

" Comb [your]91-harry hair ! "[118-uncle vernon] [he]118-uncle vernon barked , by way of a morning greeting .

together]538-the rest of the boys in his class put together , but it made no difference , [his]91-harry hair simply grew that way -- all over [the place]458-the place .

"[102-aunt petunia] [She]102-aunt petunia jerked [her]102-aunt petunia head in [Harry]91-harry 's direction .

Once , [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia , tired of [Harry]91-harry coming back from [the barbers]570-the barbers looking as though [he]91-harry had n't been at all , had taken a pair of kitchen scissors and cut [his]91-harry hair so short [he]91-harry was almost bald except for [his]91-harry bangs , which [she]102-aunt petunia left " to hide that horrible scar . "[102-aunt petunia] [Dudley]94-dudley had laughed [himself]94-dudley silly at [Harry]91-harry , who spent a sleepless night imagining [school]571-school the next day , where [he]91-harry was already laughed at for [his]91-harry baggy clothes and taped glasses . Next morning , however , [he]91-harry had gotten up to find [his]91-harry hair exactly as it had been before [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia had sheared it off [He]91-harry had been given a week in [[his]91-harry cupboard]572-his cupboard for this , even though [he]91-harry had tried to explain that [he]91-harry could n't explain how it had grown back so quickly .

Another time , [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia had been trying to force [him]91-harry into a revolting old sweater of [Dudley]94-dudley 's ( brown with orange puff balls ) -- The harder [she]102-aunt petunia tried to pull it over [his]91-harry head , the smaller it seemed to become , until finally it might have fitted a hand puppet , but certainly would n't fit [Harry]91-harry . [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia had decided it must have shrunk in the wash and , to [his]91-harry great relief , [Harry]91-harry was n't punished .

On the other hand , [he]91-harry 'd gotten into terrible trouble for being found on the roof of [the school kitchens]573-the school kitchens . [[Dudley]94-dudley 's gang]574-dudley 's gang had been chasing [him]91-harry as usual when , as much to [Harry]91-harry 's surprise as [anyone else]575-anyone else 's , there [he]91-harry was sitting on the chimney . [The Dursleys]93-the dursleys had received a very angry letter from [[Harry]91-harry 's headmistress]576-harry 's headmistress telling [them]93-the dursleys [Harry]91-harry had been climbing [school buildings]577-school buildings . But all [he]91-harry 'd tried to do ( as [he]91-harry shouted at [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon through the locked door of [[his]91-harry cupboard]572-his cupboard ) was jump behind the big trash cans outside the kitchen doors . [Harry]91-harry supposed that the wind must have caught [him]91-harry in mid- jump .

But today , nothing was going to go wrong . It was even worth being with [Dudley]94-dudley and [Piers]130-piers to be spending the day somewhere that was n't school , [[his]91-harry cupboard]572-his cupboard , or [[Mrs. Figg]122-mrs. figg 's cabbage - smelling living room]580-mrs. figg 's cabbage - smelling living room .

While [he]91-harry drove , [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon complained to [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia . [He]118-uncle vernon liked to complain about things : [people at work]581-people at work , [Harry]91-harry , [the council]582-the council , [Harry]91-harry , [the bank]583-the bank , and [Harry]91-harry were just a few of [his]118-uncle vernon favorite subjects . This morning , it was motorcycles .

[I]0-i had a dream about [a motorcycle]584-a motorcycle , " said [Harry]91-harry , remembering suddenly . "[0-i] It was flying . "[0-i]

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon nearly crashed into [the car]2431-the car in front . [He]118-uncle vernon turned right around in [his]118-uncle vernon seat and yelled at [Harry]91-harry , [his]118-uncle vernon face like a gigantic beet with a mustache : " MOTORCYCLES DON'T FLY ! "[118-uncle vernon]

[Dudley]94-dudley and [Piers]130-piers sniggered .

[I]0-i know [they]585-them do n't , " said [Harry]91-harry . "[0-i] It was only a dream . "[0-i]

But [he]91-harry wished [he]91-harry had n't said anything . If there was one thing [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys hated even more than [his]91-harry asking questions , it was [his]91-harry talking about anything acting in a way it should n't , no matter if it was in a dream or even a cartoon -- [they]93-the dursleys seemed to think [he]91-harry might get dangerous ideas .

It was a very sunny Saturday and [the zoo]2430-the zoo was crowded with [families]589-families . [The Dursleys]93-the dursleys bought [Dudley]94-dudley and [Piers]130-piers large chocolate ice creams at the entrance and then , because [the smiling lady in [the van]591-the van]590-the smiling lady in the van had asked [Harry]91-harry what [he]91-harry wanted before [they]93-the dursleys could hurry [him]91-harry away , [they]93-the dursleys bought [him]91-harry a cheap lemon ice pop . It was n't bad , either , [Harry]91-harry thought , licking it as [they]93-the dursleys watched a gorilla scratching its head who looked remarkably like [Dudley]94-dudley , except that it was n't blond .

[Harry]91-harry had the best morning [he]91-harry 'd had in a long time . [He]91-harry was careful to walk a little way apart from [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys so that [Dudley]94-dudley and [Piers]130-piers , who were starting to get bored with the animals by lunchtime , would n't fall back on [their]93-the dursleys favorite hobby of hitting [him]91-harry . [They]93-the dursleys ate in [the zoo restaurant]592-the zoo restaurant , and when [Dudley]94-dudley had a tantrum because [his]94-dudley knickerbocker glory did n't have enough ice cream on top , [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon bought [him]94-dudley another one and [Harry]91-harry was allowed to finish the first .

[Harry]91-harry felt , afterward , that [he]91-harry should have known it was all too good to last .

After lunch [they]93-the dursleys went to [the reptile house]593-the reptile house . [It]593-the reptile house was cool and dark in there , with lit windows all along the walls . Behind the glass , all sorts of lizards and snakes were crawling and slithering over bits of wood and stone . [Dudley]94-dudley and [Piers]130-piers wanted to see huge , poisonous cobras and thick , man - crushing pythons . [Dudley]94-dudley quickly found the largest snake in [the place]458-the place . [It]595-it could have wrapped [its]595-it body twice around [[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon 's car]596-uncle vernon 's car and crushed it into a trash can -- but at the moment it did n't look in the mood . In fact , it was fast asleep .

[Dudley]94-dudley stood with [his]94-dudley nose pressed against the glass , staring at the glistening brown coils .

" Make it move , "[94-dudley] [he]94-dudley whined at [[his]94-dudley father]523-his father . [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon tapped on the glass , but the snake did n't budge .

" Do it again , "[94-dudley] [Dudley]94-dudley ordered . [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon rapped the glass smartly with [his]118-uncle vernon knuckles , but the snake just snoozed on .

" This is boring , "[94-dudley] [Dudley]94-dudley moaned . [He]94-dudley shuffled away .

[Harry]91-harry moved in front of the tank and looked intently at the snake . [He]91-harry would n't have been surprised if it had died of boredom itself -- no company except [stupid people]598-stupid people drumming [their]598-stupid people fingers on the glass trying to disturb it all day long . The snake suddenly opened [its]603-its beady eyes . Slowly , very slowly , [it]603-its raised its head until [its]603-its eyes were on a level with [Harry]91-harry 's .

[It]603-its winked .

[Harry]91-harry stared . Then [he]91-harry looked quickly around to see if [anyone]375-anyone was watching . [They]375-anyone were n't . [He]91-harry looked back at the snake and winked , too .

The snake jerked [its]603-its head toward [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon and [Dudley]94-dudley , then raised [its]603-its eyes to the ceiling . It gave [Harry]91-harry a look that said quite plainly :

" [I]603-its get that all the time .[603-its]

" [I]91-harry know , "[91-harry] [Harry]91-harry murmured through the glass , though [he]91-harry was n't sure the snake could hear [him]91-harry . " It must be really annoying . "[91-harry]

[The snake]605-the snake nodded vigorously .

" Where do [you]605-the snake come from , anyway ? "[91-harry] [Harry]91-harry asked .

The snake jabbed its tail at a little sign next to the glass . [Harry]91-harry peered at it .

[Boa Constrictor]10-boa constrictor , [Brazil]11-brazil .

" Was it nice there ? "[91-harry]

" [DUDLEY]94-dudley ! [MR . DURSLEY]92-mr. dursley ! COME AND LOOK AT [THIS SNAKE]2438-this snake ! [YOU]91-harry WON'T BELIEVE WHAT [IT]2438-this snake 'S DOING ! "[91-harry]

[Dudley]94-dudley came waddling toward [them]607-both of them as fast as [he]94-dudley could .

" Out of the way , [you]91-harry , "[94-dudley] [he]94-dudley said , punching [Harry]91-harry in the ribs . Caught by surprise , [Harry]91-harry fell hard on the concrete floor . [People throughout [the reptile house]593-the reptile house]609-people throughout the reptile house screamed and started running for the exits .

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon waited until [Piers]130-piers was safely out of [the house]393-the house before starting on [Harry]91-harry . [Harry]91-harry lay in [his]91-harry dark cupboard much later , wishing [he]91-harry had a watch . [He]91-harry did n't know what time it was and [he]91-harry could n't be sure [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys were asleep yet . [He]91-harry 'd lived with [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys almost ten years , ten miserable years , as long as [he]91-harry could remember , ever since [he]91-harry 'd been [a baby]521-a baby and [[his]91-harry parents]548-his parents had died in that car crash . [He]91-harry could n't remember [[his]91-harry parents]548-his parents at all . When [he]91-harry had been younger , [Harry]91-harry had dreamed and dreamed of [some unknown relation]625-some unknown relation coming to take [him]91-harry away , but it had never happened ; [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys were [[his]91-harry only family]626-his only family . At [school]571-school , [Harry]91-harry had [no one]2380-no one . CHAPTER THREE

THE LETTERS FROM [NO ONE]2380-no one

The escape of [the Brazilian boa constrictor]646-the brazilian boa constrictor earned [Harry]91-harry [his]91-harry longest - ever punishment . By the time [he]91-harry was allowed out of [[his]91-harry cupboard]572-his cupboard again , the summer holidays had started and [Dudley]94-dudley had already broken [his]94-dudley new video camera , crashed [his]94-dudley remote control airplane , and , first time out on [his]94-dudley racing bike , knocked down [old Mrs. Figg]122-mrs. figg as [she]122-mrs. figg crossed [Privet Drive]1-privet drive on [her]122-mrs. figg crutches .

[Harry]91-harry was glad [school]571-school was over , but there was no escaping [[Dudley]94-dudley 's gang]574-dudley 's gang , who visited [the house]393-the house every single day . [Piers]130-piers , [Dennis]131-dennis , [Malcolm]132-malcolm , and [Gordon]133-gordon were all big and stupid , but as [Dudley]94-dudley was the biggest and stupidest of [the lot]651-the lot , [he]94-dudley was [the leader]652-the leader . [The rest of them]653-the rest of them were all quite happy to join in [Dudley]94-dudley 's favorite sport : [Harry Hunting]91-harry .

This was why [Harry]91-harry spent as much time as possible out of [the house]393-the house , wandering around and thinking about the end of the holidays , where [he]91-harry could see a tiny ray of hope . When [September]135-september came [he]91-harry would be going off to [secondary school]655-secondary school and , for the first time in [his]91-harry life , [he]91-harry would n't be with [Dudley]94-dudley . [Dudley]94-dudley had been accepted at [[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon 's old private school]118-uncle vernon , [Smeltings]13-smeltings . [Piers Polkiss]130-piers was going [there]555-there too . [Harry]91-harry , on the other hand , was going to [Stonewall High]15-stonewall high , [the local public school]657-the local public school . [Dudley]94-dudley thought this was very funny .

" [They]2441-they stuff [people]2354-people 's heads down the toilet the first day at [Stonewall]16-stonewall , "[94-dudley] [he]94-dudley told [Harry]91-harry . " Want to come [upstairs]464-upstairs and practice ? "[94-dudley]

" No , thanks , "[91-harry] said [Harry]91-harry . " [The poor toilet 's]2444-the poor toilet 's never had anything as horrible as [your]94-dudley head down it -- it might be sick . "[91-harry] Then [he]91-harry ran , before [Dudley]94-dudley could work out what [he]91-harry 'd said .

One day in [July]17-july , [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia took [Dudley]94-dudley to [London]18-london to buy [his]94-dudley Smeltings uniform , leaving [Harry]91-harry at [Mrs. Figg]122-mrs. figg 's . [Mrs. Figg]122-mrs. figg wasn ' t as bad as usual . It turned out [she]122-mrs. figg 'd broken [her]122-mrs. figg leg tripping over one of [her]122-mrs. figg cats , and [she]122-mrs. figg did n't seem quite as fond of [them]658-them as before . [She]122-mrs. figg let [Harry]91-harry watch television and gave [him]91-harry a bit of chocolate cake that tasted as though [she]122-mrs. figg 'd had it for several years .

That evening , [Dudley]94-dudley paraded around [the living room]454-the living room for [the family]660-the family in [his]94-dudley brand - new uniform . [Smeltings ' boys]661-smeltings ' boys wore maroon tailcoats , orange knickerbockers , and flat straw hats called [boaters]662-boaters . [They]661-smeltings ' boys also carried knobbly sticks , used for hitting each other while [the teachers]663-the teachers were n't looking . This was supposed to be good training for later life .

As [he]91-harry looked at [Dudley]94-dudley in [his]94-dudley new knickerbockers , [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon said gruffly that it was the proudest moment of [his]91-harry life . [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia burst into tears and said [she]102-aunt petunia could n't believe it was [her]102-aunt petunia [Ickle Dudleykins]136-ickle dudleykins , [he]94-dudley looked so handsome and grown - up . [Harry]91-harry did n't trust [himself]91-harry to speak . [He]91-harry thought two of [his]91-harry ribs might already have cracked from trying not to laugh .

There was a horrible smell in [the kitchen]529-the kitchen the next morning when [Harry]91-harry went in for breakfast . It seemed to be coming from a large metal tub in the sink . [He]91-harry went to have a look . [The tub]665-the tub was full of what looked like dirty rags swimming in gray water .

" What 's this ? "[91-harry] [he]91-harry asked [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia . [Her]102-aunt petunia lips tightened as they always did if [he]91-harry dared to ask a question .

" [Your]91-harry new school uniform , "[102-aunt petunia] [she]102-aunt petunia said .

[Harry]91-harry looked in the bowl again .

" Oh , "[91-harry] [he]91-harry said , " [I]91-harry did n't realize it had to be so wet . "[91-harry]

" DotA be stupid , "[102-aunt petunia] snapped [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia . " [I]102-aunt petunia 'm dyeing some of [Dudley]94-dudley 's old things gray for [you]91-harry . It 'll look just like [everyone else]2445-everyone else 's when [I]102-aunt petunia 've finished . "[102-aunt petunia]

[Harry]91-harry seriously doubted this , but thought it best not to argue . [He]91-harry sat down at the table and tried not to think about how [he]91-harry was going to look on [his]91-harry first day at [Stonewall High]15-stonewall high -- like [he]91-harry was wearing bits of old elephant skin , probably .

[Dudley]94-dudley and [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon came in , both with wrinkled noses because of the smell from [Harry]91-harry 's new uniform . [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon opened [his]118-uncle vernon newspaper as usual and [Dudley]94-dudley banged [his]94-dudley Smelting stick , which [he]94-dudley carried everywhere , on the table .

[They]666-they heard the click of the mail slot and flop of letters on the doormat .

" Get the mail , [Dudley]94-dudley , "[118-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon from behind [his]118-uncle vernon paper .

" Make [Harry]91-harry get it . "[666-they]

" Get the mail , [Harry]91-harry . "[666-they]

" Make [Dudley]94-dudley get it . "[666-they]

" Poke [him]94-dudley with [your]94-dudley Smelting stick , [Dudley]94-dudley . "[666-they]

[Harry]91-harry dodged the Smelting stick and went to get the mail . Three things lay on the doormat : a postcard from [[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon 's sister]667-uncle vernon 's sister [Marge]119-marge , who was vacationing on [the Isle of Wight]668-the isle of wight , a brown envelope that looked like a bill , and -- a letter for [Harry]91-harry .

[Harry]91-harry picked it up and stared at it , [his]91-harry heart twanging like a giant elastic band . [No one]2380-no one , ever , in [his]91-harry whole life , had written to [him]91-harry . Who would ? [He]91-harry had [no friends]670-no friends , [no other relatives]671-no other relatives -- [he]91-harry did n't belong to [the library]672-the library , so [he]91-harry 'd never even got rude notes asking for books back . Yet here it was , a letter , addressed so plainly there could be no mistake :

[Mr. H. Potter]137-mr. h. potter

[The Cupboard under the Stairs

4 Privet Drive

Little Whinging

Surrey]673-the cupboard under the stairs 4 privet drive little whinging surrey

The envelope was thick and heavy , made of yellowish parchment , and the address was written in emerald - green ink . There was no stamp .

Turning the envelope over , [his]91-harry hand trembling , [Harry]91-harry saw a purple wax seal bearing a coat of arms ; a lion , an eagle , a badger , and a snake surrounding a large letter H.

" Hurry up , [boy]2435-boy ! "[118-uncle vernon] shouted [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon from [the kitchen]529-the kitchen . " What are [you]2435-boy doing , checking for letter bombs ? "[118-uncle vernon] [He]118-uncle vernon chuckled at [his]118-uncle vernon own joke .

[Harry]91-harry went back to [the kitchen]529-the kitchen , still staring at [his]91-harry letter . [He]91-harry handed [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon the bill and the postcard , sat down , and slowly began to open the yellow envelope .

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon ripped open the bill , snorted in disgust , and flipped over the postcard .

" [Marge]119-marge 's ill , "[118-uncle vernon] [he]118-uncle vernon informed [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia . " Ate a funny whelk . -- . "[118-uncle vernon]

" [Dad]138-dad ! "[94-dudley] said [Dudley]94-dudley suddenly . " [Dad]138-dad , [Harry]91-harry 's got something ! "[94-dudley]

[Harry]91-harry was on the point of unfolding [his]91-harry letter , which was written on the same heavy parchment as the envelope , when it was jerked sharply out of [his]91-harry hand by [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon .

" That 's mine ! "[91-harry] said [Harry]91-harry , trying to snatch it back .

" Who 'd be writing to [you]91-harry ? "[118-uncle vernon] sneered [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon , shaking the letter open with one hand and glancing at it . [His]118-uncle vernon face went from red to green faster than a set of traffic lights . And it did n't stop there . Within seconds it was the grayish white of old porridge .

" P - P - [Petunia]102-aunt petunia ! "[118-uncle vernon] [he]118-uncle vernon gasped .

[Dudley]94-dudley tried to grab the letter to read it , but [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon held it high out of [his]94-dudley reach . [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia took it curiously and read the first line . For a moment it looked as though [she]102-aunt petunia might faint . [She]102-aunt petunia clutched [her]102-aunt petunia throat and made a choking noise .

" [Vernon]118-uncle vernon ! Oh [my]102-aunt petunia goodness -- [Vernon]118-uncle vernon ! "[102-aunt petunia]

[They]676-they stared at [each other]677-each other , seeming to have forgotten that [Harry]91-harry and [Dudley]94-dudley were still in [the room]525-the room . [Dudley]94-dudley was n't used to being ignored . [He]94-dudley gave [[his]94-dudley father]523-his father a sharp tap on the head with [his]94-dudley Smelting stick .

" [I]94-dudley want to read that letter , "[94-dudley] [he]94-dudley said loudly . want to read it , " said [Harry]91-harry furiously , "[94-dudley] as it 's [mine]91-harry . "[94-dudley]

" Get out , both of [you]2447-you , "[118-uncle vernon] croaked [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon , stuffing the letter back inside its envelope .

[Harry]91-harry did n't move .

" [Daddy]121-daddy 's gone mad , has n't [he]121-daddy ? "[94-dudley] [Dudley]94-dudley asked [Aunt Petunia dully]102-aunt petunia late that afternoon . " It 's Monday , "[94-dudley] [he]94-dudley told [[his]94-dudley mother]2393-his mother . " [The Great Humberto]139-the great humberto 's on tonight . [I]94-dudley want to stay somewhere with a television . "[94-dudley]

Monday . This reminded [Harry]91-harry of something . [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon was back and [he]118-uncle vernon was smiling . [He]118-uncle vernon was also carrying a long , thin package and did n't answer [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia when [she]102-aunt petunia asked what [he]118-uncle vernon 'd bought .

" Storm forecast for tonight ! "[118-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon gleefully , clapping [his]118-uncle vernon hands together . " And [this gentleman]2475-this gentleman 's kindly agreed to lend [us]757-them [[his]2475-this gentleman boat]2476-his boat ! "[118-uncle vernon]

[A toothless old man]756-a toothless old man came ambling up to [them]757-them , pointing , with a rather wicked grin , at [an old rowboat bobbing in the iron - gray water below [them]757-them]758-an old rowboat bobbing in the iron - gray water below them .

" [I]118-uncle vernon 've already got [us]757-them some rations , "[118-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon , " so all aboard ! "[118-uncle vernon]

It was freezing in [the boat]759-the boat . Icy sea spray and rain crept down [their]757-them necks and a chilly wind whipped [their]757-them faces . After what seemed like hours [they]757-them reached [the rock]760-the rock , where [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon , slipping and sliding , led the way to [the broken - down house]761-the broken - down house .

The inside was horrible ; it smelled strongly of seaweed , the wind whistled through the gaps in the wooden walls , and the fireplace was damp and empty . There were only [two rooms]762-two rooms .

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon 's rations turned out to be a bag of chips each and four bananas . [He]118-uncle vernon tried to start a fire but the empty chip bags just smoked and shriveled up .

" Could do with some of those letters now , eh ? "[118-uncle vernon] [he]118-uncle vernon said cheerfully .

[He]118-uncle vernon was in a very good mood . Obviously [he]118-uncle vernon thought [nobody]643-nobody stood a chance of reaching [them]757-them here in a storm to deliver mail . [Harry]91-harry privately agreed , though the thought did n't cheer [him]91-harry up at all .

As night fell , the promised storm blew up around [them]757-them . Spray from the high waves splattered the walls of [the hut]764-the hut and a fierce wind rattled the filthy windows . [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia found a few moldy blankets in [the second room]765-the second room and made up a bed for [Dudley]94-dudley on the moth - eaten sofa . [She]102-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon went off to the lumpy bed next door , and [Harry]91-harry was left to find the softest bit of floor [he]91-harry could and to curl up under the thinnest , most ragged blanket .

The storm raged more and more ferociously as the night went on . [Harry]91-harry could n't sleep . [He]91-harry shivered and turned over , trying to get comfortable , [his]91-harry stomach rumbling with hunger . [Dudley]94-dudley 's snores were drowned by the low rolls of thunder that started near midnight . The lighted dial of [Dudley]94-dudley 's watch , which was dangling over the edge of the sofa on [his]94-dudley fat wrist , told [Harry]91-harry [he]91-harry 'd be eleven in ten minutes ' time . [He]91-harry lay and watched [his]91-harry birthday tick nearer , wondering if [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys would remember at all , wondering where [the letter writer]766-the letter writer was now .

Five minutes to go . [Harry]91-harry heard something creak outside . [He]91-harry hoped the roof was n't going to fall in , although [he]91-harry might be warmer if it did . Four minutes to go . Maybe [the house in [Privet Drive]1-privet drive]767-the house in privet drive would be so full of letters when [they]93-the dursleys got back that [he]91-harry 'd be able to steal one somehow .

Three minutes to go . Was that [the sea]768-the sea , slapping hard on the rock like that ? And ( two minutes to go ) what was that funny crunching noise ? Was the rock crumbling into [the sea]768-the sea ?

One minute to go and [he]91-harry 'd be eleven . Thirty seconds ... twenty ... ten ... nine -- maybe [he]91-harry 'd wake [Dudley]94-dudley up , just to annoy [him]94-dudley -- three ... two ... one ...

BOOM .

[The whole shack]770-the whole shack shivered and [Harry]91-harry sat bolt upright , staring at the door . [Someone]713-someone was outside , knocking to come in .

CHAPTER FOUR

[THE KEEPER OF THE KEYS

BOOM]140-the keeper of the keys boom . [They]772-them knocked again . [Dudley]94-dudley jerked awake . " Where 's the cannon ? "[94-dudley] [he]94-dudley said stupidly .

There was a crash behind [them]772-them and [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon came skidding into [the room]525-the room . [He]118-uncle vernon was holding a rifle in [his]118-uncle vernon hands -- now [they]772-them knew what had been in the long , thin package [he]118-uncle vernon had brought with [them]772-them .

" Who 's there ? "[118-uncle vernon] [he]118-uncle vernon shouted . " [I]118-uncle vernon warn [you]772-them -- [I]118-uncle vernon 'm armed ! "[118-uncle vernon]

There was a pause . Then --

SMASH !

The door was hit with such force that it swung clean off its hinges and with a deafening crash landed flat on the floor .

[A giant of a man]774-a giant of a man was standing in the doorway . [His]774-a giant of a man face was almost completely hidden by a long , shaggy mane of hair and a wild , tangled beard , but [you]775-you could make out [his]774-a giant of a man eyes , glinting like black beetles under all the hair .

[The giant]497-the giant squeezed [his]497-the giant way into [the hut]764-the hut , stooping so that [his]497-the giant head just brushed the ceiling . [He]497-the giant bent down , picked up the door , and fitted it easily back into its frame . The noise of the storm outside dropped a little . [He]497-the giant turned to look at [them]772-them all .

" Could n't make [us]772-them a cup o ' tea , could [yeh]772-them ? It 's not been an easy journey ... "[497-the giant]

[He]497-the giant strode over to the sofa where [Dudley]94-dudley sat frozen with fear .

"[281-hagrid]

Something very painful was going on in [Harry]91-harry 's mind . " Load of old tosh , "[118-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon . [Harry]91-harry jumped ; [he]91-harry had almost forgotten that [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys were [there]555-there . "[281-hagrid]

CHAPTER FIVE

[DIAGON ALLEY]27-diagon alley

[People]2354-people stared more than ever on [the train]855-the train . [Hagrid]281-hagrid took up two seats and sat knitting what looked like a canary - yellow circus tent .

" Still got [yer]91-harry letter , [Harry]91-harry ? "[281-hagrid] [he]281-hagrid asked as [he]281-hagrid counted stitches . [Harry]91-harry took the parchment envelope out of [his]91-harry pocket .

" Good , "[281-hagrid] said [Hagrid]281-hagrid . " There 's a list there of everything [yeh]91-harry need . "[281-hagrid]

[Harry]91-harry unfolded a second piece of paper [he]91-harry had n't noticed the night before , and read :

HOGWARTS [SCHOOL of WITCHCRAFT]856-school of witchcraft and [WIZARDRY

UNIFORM

First - year students]857-wizardry uniform first - year students will require :

1 . Three sets of plain work robes ( black )

2 . One plain pointed hat ( black ) for day wear

3 . One pair of protective gloves ( dragon hide or similar )

4 . One winter cloak ( black , silver fastenings )

Please note that [all pupils]858-all pupils ' clothes should carry name tags

[Harry]91-harry had never been to [London]18-london before . [Harry]91-harry took the wand . [He]91-harry felt a sudden warmth in [his]91-harry fingers . [Harry]91-harry shivered . [He]91-harry was n't sure [he]91-harry liked [Mr. Ollivander]182-mr. ollivander too much . [He]91-harry paid seven gold Galleons for [his]91-harry wand , and [Mr. Ollivander]182-mr. ollivander bowed [them]1004-them from [[his]182-mr. ollivander shop]1005-his shop .

The late afternoon sun hung low in the sky as [Harry]91-harry and [Hagrid]281-hagrid made [their]1006-they way back down [Diagon Alley]27-diagon alley , back through the wall , back through [the Leaky Cauldron]2627-the leaky cauldron , now empty . [Harry]91-harry did n't speak at all as [they]1006-they walked down [the road]399-the road ; [he]91-harry did n't even notice how much [people]2354-people were gawking at [them]1006-they on [the Underground]2617-the underground , laden as [they]1006-they were with all [their]1006-they funny - shaped packages , with the snowy owl asleep in its cage on [Harry]91-harry 's lap . Up [another escalator]1011-another escalator , out into [Paddington station]1012-paddington station ; [Harry]91-harry only realized where [they]1006-they were when [Hagrid]281-hagrid tapped [him]91-harry on the shoulder .

" Got time fer a bite to eat before [[yer]91-harry train]2711-yer train leaves , "[281-hagrid] [he]281-hagrid said .

[He]281-hagrid bought [Harry]91-harry a hamburger and [they]1006-they sat down on plastic seats to eat them . [Harry]91-harry kept looking around . Everything looked so strange , somehow .

" [You]91-harry all right , [Harry]91-harry ? [Yer]91-harry very quiet , "[281-hagrid] said [Hagrid]281-hagrid .

[Harry]91-harry was n't sure [he]91-harry could explain . [He]91-harry 'd just had the best birthday of [his]91-harry life -- and yet -- [he]91-harry chewed [his]91-harry hamburger , trying to find the words .

" [Everyone]2365-everyone thinks [I]91-harry 'm special , "[91-harry] [he]91-harry said at last . [Hagrid]281-hagrid leaned across the table . Behind the wild beard and eyebrows [he]281-hagrid wore a very kind smile .

[The train]855-the train pulled out of [the station]848-the station . CHAPTER SIX

THE JOURNEY FROM [PLATFORM NINE]40-platform nine AND THREE - QUARTERS

[Harry]91-harry 's last month with [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys was n't fun . True , [Dudley]94-dudley was now so scared of [Harry]91-harry [he]91-harry would n't stay in [the same room]1016-the same room , while [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia and [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon did n't shut [Harry]91-harry in [his]91-harry cupboard , force [him]91-harry to do anything , or shout at [him]91-harry -- in fact , [they]1017-they did n't speak to [him]91-harry at all . Half terrified , half furious , [they]1017-they acted as though any chair with [Harry]91-harry in [it]1018-it were empty . Although this was an improvement in many ways , it did become a bit depressing after a while .

[Harry]91-harry kept to [[his]91-harry room]705-his room , with [his]91-harry new owl for company . [He]91-harry had decided to call [her]1020-her [Hedwig]184-hedwig , a name [he]91-harry had found in A History of Magic . [His]91-harry school books were very interesting . [He]91-harry lay on [his]91-harry bed reading late into the night , [Hedwig]184-hedwig swooping in and out of the open window as [she]1020-her pleased . It was lucky that [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia did n't come in to vacuum anymore , because [Hedwig]184-hedwig kept bringing back dead mice . Every night before [he]91-harry went to sleep , [Harry]91-harry ticked off another day on the piece of paper [he]91-harry had pinned to the wall , counting down to September the first .

On the last day of August [he]91-harry thought [he]91-harry 'd better speak to [[his]91-harry aunt]2384-his aunt and [uncle]2385-uncle about getting to [King 's Cross station]1023-king 's cross station the next day , so [he]91-harry went down to [the living room]454-the living room where [they]1025-they were watching a quiz show on television . [He]91-harry cleared [his]91-harry throat to let [them]1025-they know [he]91-harry was there , and [Dudley]94-dudley screamed and ran from [the room]525-the room .

" Er -- [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon ? "[94-dudley]

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon grunted to show [he]118-uncle vernon was listening .

" Er -- [I]118-uncle vernon need to be at [King 's Cross]41-king 's cross tomorrow to -- to go to [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts . "[118-uncle vernon]

[Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon grunted again .

" Thank [you]118-uncle vernon . "[185-grunt]

[He]91-harry was about to go back [upstairs]464-upstairs when [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon actually spoke .

[Harry]91-harry did n't say anything .

" Nine and three - quarters . "[2385-uncle]

" Why are [you]118-uncle vernon going to [London]18-london ? "[91-harry] [Harry]91-harry asked , trying to keep things friendly .

[Harry]91-harry woke at five o'clock the next morning and was too excited and nervous to go back to sleep . [He]91-harry got up and pulled on [his]91-harry jeans because [he]91-harry did n't want to walk into [the station]848-the station in [his]91-harry wizard 's robes -- [he]91-harry 'd change on [the train]855-the train . [He]91-harry checked [his]91-harry Hogwarts list yet again to make sure [he]91-harry had everything [he]91-harry needed , saw that [Hedwig]184-hedwig was shut safely in [her]184-hedwig cage , and then paced [the room]525-the room , waiting for [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys to get up . " Well , there [you]91-harry are , [boy]2435-boy . [Platform nine]40-platform nine -- platform ten . "[118-uncle vernon]

[He]91-harry was quite right , of course . There was a big plastic number nine over [one platform]1038-one platform and a big plastic number ten over the one next to it , and in the middle , nothing at all .

" Have a good term , "[118-uncle vernon] said [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon with an even nastier smile . [He]118-uncle vernon left without another word . In the end [the guard]1042-the guard strode away , muttering about time wasters . [Harry]91-harry was now trying hard not to panic . [Hagrid]281-hagrid must have forgotten to tell [him]91-harry something [you]91-harry had to do , like tapping the third brick on the left to get into [Diagon Alley]27-diagon alley . " -- packed with Muggles , of course -- "[1050-a group of people]

CHAPTER SEVEN

THE SORTING HAT

The door swung open at once . [A tall , black - haired witch in emerald - green robes]1238-a tall , black - haired witch in emerald - green robes stood there . [She]1238-a tall , black - haired witch in emerald - green robes had a very stern face and [Harry]91-harry 's first thought was that this was not [someone to cross]1239-someone to cross .

" The firs ' years , [Professor McGonagall]105-harry , "[281-hagrid] said [Hagrid]281-hagrid .

" Thank [you]105-harry , [Hagrid]281-hagrid . [I]1238-a tall , black - haired witch in emerald - green robes will take [them]1244-they from here . "[1238-a tall , black - haired witch in emerald - green robes]

[She]1238-a tall , black - haired witch in emerald - green robes pulled the door wide . [The entrance hall]1240-the entrance hall was so big [you]1241-you could have fit [the whole of [[the Dursleys]93-the dursleys ' house]501-the dursleys ' house]1242-the whole of the dursleys ' house in [it]1240-the entrance hall . The stone walls were lit with flaming torches like the ones at [Gringotts]28-gringotts , the ceiling was too high to make out , and a magnificent marble staircase facing [them]1244-they led to [the upper floors]1245-the upper floors .

[They]1244-they followed [Professor McGonagall]105-harry across the flagged stone floor . [Harry]105-harry could hear the drone of hundreds of voices from a doorway to the right -the rest of [the school]2544-the school must already be [here]2364-here -- but [Professor McGonagall]105-harry showed the first years into [a small , empty chamber off [the hall]533-the hall]1248-a small , empty chamber off the hall . [They]1244-they crowded in , standing rather closer together than [they]1244-they would usually have done , peering about nervously .

" Welcome to [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts , "[105-harry] said [Professor McGonagall]105-harry . " The start - of - term banquet will begin shortly , but before [you]1241-you take [your]1241-you seats in [the Great Hall]2848-the great hall , [you]1241-you will be sorted into [[your]1241-you houses]2849-your houses . The Sorting is a very important ceremony because , while [you]1241-you are [here]2364-here , [[your]1241-you house]2851-your house will be something like [[your]1241-you family]2764-your family within [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts . [You]1241-you will have classes with the rest of [[your]1241-you house]2851-your house , sleep in [[your]1241-you house dormitory]2854-your house dormitory , and spend free time in [[your]1241-you house common room]2855-your house common room .[105-harry]

" [The four houses]2856-the four houses are called [Gryffindor]225-gryffindor , [Hufflepuff]35-hufflepuff , [Ravenclaw]218-ravenclaw , and [Slytherin]176-slytherin . [Each house]2857-each house has [its]2857-each house own noble history and each has produced [outstanding witches]2858-outstanding witches and [wizards]829-wizards . While [you]1241-you are at [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts , [your]1241-you triumphs will earn [your]1241-you house points , while any rulebreaking will lose house points . At the end of the year , the house with the most points is awarded the house cup , a great honor . [I]105-harry hope each of [you]1241-you will be a credit to whichever house becomes [yours]1241-you .[105-harry]

" The Sorting Ceremony will take place in a few minutes in front of [the rest of [the school]2544-the school]2860-the rest of the school . [I]1250-i suggest [you]1241-you all smarten [yourselves]1241-you up as much as [you]1241-you can while [you]1241-you are waiting . "[1250-i]

[Her]1250-i eyes lingered for a moment on [Neville]194-neville 's cloak , which was fastened under [his]194-neville left ear , and on [Ron]191-ron 's smudged nose . [Harry]105-harry nervously tried to flatten [his]105-harry hair .

" [I]105-harry shall return when [we]2862-we are ready for [you]1241-you , "[105-harry] said [Professor McGonagall]105-harry . " Please wait quietly . "[105-harry]

[She]1250-i left [the chamber]1251-the chamber . [Harry]105-harry swallowed .

" How exactly do [they]2863-they sort [us]2862-we into [houses]1139-houses ? "[105-harry] [he]105-harry asked [Ron]191-ron .

" Some sort of test , [I]191-ron think . [Fred]189-fred said it hurts a lot , but [I]191-ron think [he]189-fred was joking . "[191-ron]

[Harry]105-harry 's heart gave a horrible jolt . A test ? In front of [the whole school]1252-the whole school ? But [he]105-harry did n't know any magic yet -- what on earth would [he]105-harry have to do ? [He]105-harry had n't expected something like this the moment [they]1253-they arrived . [He]105-harry looked around anxiously and saw that [everyone else]2445-everyone else looked terrified , too . [No one]2380-no one was talking much except [Hermione Granger]216-hermione , who was whispering very fast about all the spells [she]216-hermione 'd learned and wondering which one [she]216-hermione 'd need . [Harry]105-harry tried hard not to listen to [her]216-hermione . [He]105-harry 'd never been more nervous , never , not even when [he]105-harry 'd had to take a school report [home]448-home to [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys saying that [he]105-harry 'd somehow turned [[his]105-harry teacher]1257-his teacher 's wig blue . [Hermione]216-hermione whisper , " Its bewitched to look like the sky outside . [I]216-hermione read about it in [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts , A History . "[216-hermione]

CHAPTER EIGHT

THE POTIONS MASTER

There , look . "[1383-people lining up outside classrooms]

" Where ? "[105-harry]

" Next to [the tall kid with the red hair]2919-the tall kid with the red hair . "[1383-people lining up outside classrooms]

" Wearing the glasses ? "[105-harry]

" Did [you]105-harry see [his]105-harry face ? "[1383-people lining up outside classrooms]

" Did [you]105-harry see [his]105-harry scar ? "[105-harry]

Whispers followed [Harry]105-harry from the moment [he]105-harry left [[his]105-harry dormitory]1382-his dormitory the next day . [People lining up outside classrooms]1383-people lining up outside classrooms stood on tiptoe to get a look at [him]105-harry , or doubled back to pass [him]105-harry in [the corridors]2841-the corridors again , staring . [Harry]105-harry wished [they]1383-people lining up outside classrooms would n't , because [he]105-harry was trying to concentrate on finding [his]105-harry way to classes .

There were a hundred and forty - two staircases at [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts : wide , sweeping ones ; [narrow , rickety ones]1385-narrow , rickety ones ; some that led somewhere different on a Friday ; some with a vanishing step halfway up that [you]1386-you had to remember to jump . Then there were doors that would n't open unless [you]1386-you asked politely , or tickled them in exactly the right place , and doors that were n't really doors at all , but solid walls just pretending . It was also very hard to remember where anything was , because it all seemed to move around a lot . [The people in the portraits]1367-the people in the portraits kept going to visit [each other]677-each other , and [Harry]105-harry was sure the coats of armor could walk .

[The ghosts]1389-the ghosts did n't help , either . It was always a nasty shock when one of [them]1389-the ghosts glided suddenly through a door [you]1386-you were trying to open . [Nearly Headless Nick]258-nearly headless nick was always happy to point [new Gryffindors]259-gryffindors in the right direction , but [Peeves]228-peeves [the Poltergeist]1390-the poltergeist was worth two locked doors and a trick staircase if [you]1386-you met [him]1390-the poltergeist when [you]1386-you were late for class . [He]1390-the poltergeist would drop wastepaper baskets on [your]1386-you head , pull rugs from under [your]1386-you feet , pelt [you]1386-you with bits of chalk , or sneak up behind [you]1386-you , invisible , grab [your]1386-you nose , and screech , " GOT [YOUR]1386-you CONK ! "[2904-the caretaker]

Even worse than [Peeves]228-peeves , if that was possible , was [the caretaker]2904-the caretaker , [Argus Filch]272-filch . [Harry]105-harry and [Ron]191-ron managed to get on the wrong side of [him]1390-the poltergeist on [their]1392-they very first morning . [Filch]272-filch found [them]1392-they trying to force [their]1392-they way through a door that unluckily turned out to be the entrance to [the out - of - bounds corridor on [the third floor]1394-the third floor]1393-the out - of - bounds corridor on the third floor . [He]272-filch would n't believe [they]1392-they were lost , was sure [they]1392-they were trying to break into [it]1393-the out - of - bounds corridor on the third floor on purpose , and was threatening to lock [them]1392-they in [the dungeons]1395-the dungeons when [they]1392-they were rescued by [Professor Quirrell]165-quirrell , who was passing .

[Filch]272-filch owned a cat called [Mrs. Norris]273-mrs. norris , a scrawny , dust - colored creature with bulging , lamp like eyes just like [Filch]272-filch 's . [She]273-mrs. norris patrolled [the corridors]2841-the corridors alone . Break a rule in front of [her]273-mrs. norris , put just one toe out of line , and [she]273-mrs. norris 'd whisk off for [Filch]272-filch , who 'd appear , wheezing , two seconds later . [Filch]272-filch knew [the secret passageways of [the school]2544-the school]1397-the secret passageways of the school better than [anyone]375-anyone ( except perhaps [the Weasley twins]1326-the weasley twins ) and could pop up as suddenly as [any of [the ghosts]1389-the ghosts]1401-any of the ghosts . [The students]910-the students all hated [him]272-filch , and it was the dearest ambition of many to give [Mrs. Norris]273-mrs. norris a good kick .

And then , once [you]1404-you had managed to find [them]910-the students , there were the classes [themselves]910-the students . There was a lot more to magic , as [Harry]105-harry quickly found out , than waving [your]1404-you wand and saying a few funny words .

[They]910-the students had to study the night skies through [their]910-the students telescopes every Wednesday at midnight and learn the names of different stars and the movements of [the planets]1405-the planets . Three times a week [they]910-the students went out to [the greenhouses behind [the castle]1233-the castle]1406-the greenhouses behind the castle to study Herbology , with [a dumpy little witch called [Professor Sprout]274-professor sprout]1408-a dumpy little witch called professor sprout , where [they]910-the students learned how to take care of all the strange plants and fungi , and found out what [they]910-the students were used for .

Easily the most boring class was History of Magic , which was the only one taught by [a ghost]2867-a ghost . [Professor Binns]275-professor binns had been very old

indeed when [he]272-filch had fallen asleep in front of [the staff room]1410-the staff room fire and got up next morning to teach , leaving [his]272-filch body behind [him]272-filch . [Binns]275-professor binns droned on and on while [they]910-the students scribbled down names and dates , and got [Emetic the Evil]276-emetic the evil and [Uric the Oddball]277-uric the oddball mixed up .

[Professor Flitwick]278-professor flitwick , [the Charms teacher]1411-the charms teacher , was [a tiny little wizard who had to stand on a pile of books to see over [his]272-filch desk]1412-a tiny little wizard who had to stand on a pile of books to see over his desk . At the start of [their]910-the students first class [he]272-filch took the roll call , and when [he]272-filch reached [Harry]105-harry 's name [he]272-filch gave an excited squeak and toppled out of sight .

[Professor McGonagall]105-harry was again different . [Harry]105-harry had been quite right to think [she]1411-the charms teacher was n't [a teacher to cross]1413-a teacher to cross . Strict and clever , [she]1411-the charms teacher gave [them]910-the students a talking - to the moment [they]910-the students sat down in [her]1411-the charms teacher first class .

" Transfiguration is some of the most complex and dangerous magic [you]2920-you will learn at [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts , "[1411-the charms teacher] [she]1411-the charms teacher said . " [Anyone messing around in [my]1411-the charms teacher class]2921-anyone messing around in my class will leave and not come back . [You]2920-you have been warned . "[1411-the charms teacher]

Then [she]1411-the charms teacher changed [her]1411-the charms teacher desk into a pig and back again . [They]910-the students were all very impressed and could n't wait to get started , but soon realized [they]910-the students were n't going to be changing the furniture into animals for a long time . After taking a lot of complicated notes , [they]910-the students were each given a match and started trying to turn it into a needle . By the end of the lesson , only [Hermione Granger]216-hermione had made any difference to [her]216-hermione match ; [Professor McGonagall]105-harry showed [the class]1148-the class how it had gone all silver and pointy and gave [Hermione]216-hermione a rare smile .

The class [everyone]2365-everyone had really been looking forward to was Defense Against the Dark Arts , but [Quirrell]165-quirrell 's lessons turned out to be a bit of a joke . [[His]165-quirrell classroom]1416-his classroom smelled strongly of garlic , which [everyone]2365-everyone said was to ward off [a vampire [he]165-quirrell 'd met in [Romania]46-romania and was afraid would be coming back to get [him]165-quirrell one of these days]1418-a vampire he 'd met in romania and was afraid would be coming back to get him one of these days . [His]165-quirrell turban , [he]165-quirrell told [them]910-the students , had been given to [him]165-quirrell by [an African prince]1419-an african prince as a thank - you for getting rid of [a troublesome zombie]1420-a troublesome zombie , but [they]910-the students were n't sure [they]910-the students believed this story . For one thing , when [Seamus Finnigan]242-seamus asked eagerly to hear how [Quirrell]165-quirrell had fought off the zombie , [Quirrell]165-quirrell went pink and started talking about the weather ; for another , [they]910-the students had noticed that a funny smell hung around the turban , and [the Weasley twins]1326-the weasley twins insisted that it was stuffed full of garlic as well , so that [Quirrell]165-quirrell was protected wherever [he]165-quirrell went .

[Harry]105-harry was very relieved to find out that [he]105-harry was n't miles behind [everyone else]2445-everyone else . [Lots of [people]2354-people]1423-lots of people had come from [Muggle families]2790-muggle families and , like [him]105-harry , had n't had any idea that [they]1423-lots of people were [witches]2539-witches and [wizards]829-wizards . There was so much to learn that [even people like [Ron]191-ron]1428-even people like ron did n't have much of a head start .

Friday was an important day for [Harry]105-harry and [Ron]191-ron . [They]910-the students finally managed to find [their]910-the students way down to [the Great Hall]2848-the great hall for breakfast without getting lost once .

" What have [we]910-the students got today ? "[105-harry] [Harry]105-harry asked [Ron]191-ron as [he]191-ron poured sugar on [his]191-ron porridge .

" Double Potions with the Slytherins , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron . " [[Snape]263-snape 's Head of [Slytherin House]53-slytherin house]2922-snape 's head of slytherin house . " [Wish McGonagall]279-wish mcgonagall favored [us]910-the students , "[105-harry] said [Harry]105-harry . [Professor McGonagall]105-harry was head of [Gryffindor House]54-gryffindor house , but it had n't stopped [her]1430-her from giving [them]1431-them a huge pile of homework the day before .

Just then , the mail arrived . [Harry]105-harry had gotten used to this by now , but it had given [him]105-harry a bit of a shock on the first morning , when about a hundred owls had suddenly streamed into [the Great Hall]2848-the great hall during breakfast , circling the tables until [they]1433-their saw [[their]1433-their owners]1434-their owners , and dropping letters and packages onto [their]1433-their laps .

[Hedwig]184-hedwig had n't brought [Harry]105-harry anything so far . [She]184-hedwig sometimes flew in to nibble [his]105-harry ear and have a bit of toast before going off to sleep in [the owlery]1435-the owlery with [the other school owls]1436-the other school owls . This morning , however , [she]184-hedwig fluttered down between the marmalade and the sugar bowl and dropped a note onto [Harry]105-harry 's plate . [Harry]105-harry tore it open at once . It said , in a very untidy scrawl :

[Dear Harry]280-dear harry ,

[I]0-i know [you]105-harry get Friday afternoons off , so would [you]105-harry like to come and have a cup of tea with [me]0-i around three ?

[I]0-i want to hear all about [your]105-harry first week . Send [us]1437-us an answer back with [Hedwig]184-hedwig .

[Hagrid

Harry]281-hagrid borrowed [Ron]191-ron 's quill , scribbled Yes , please , see [you]184-hedwig later on the back of the note , and sent [Hedwig]184-hedwig off again .

It was lucky that [Harry]281-hagrid had tea with [Hagrid]281-hagrid to look forward to , because the Potions lesson turned out to be the worst thing that had happened to [him]281-hagrid so far .

At the start - of - term banquet , [Harry]281-hagrid had gotten the idea that [Professor Snape]263-snape disliked [him]281-hagrid . Potions lessons took place down in [one of [the dungeons]1395-the dungeons]1438-one of the dungeons . It was colder here than up in [the main castle]1440-the main castle , and would have been quite creepy enough without the pickled animals floating in glass jars all around the walls .

[Snape]263-snape , like [Flitwick]278-professor flitwick , started the class by taking the roll call , and like [Flitwick]278-professor flitwick , [he]263-snape paused at [Harry]281-hagrid 's name .

" [You]1443-you are here to learn the subtle science and exact art of potionmaking , "[263-snape] [he]263-snape began . "[263-snape]
