CHAPTER NINE

THE MIDNIGHT DUEL

[Harry]281-hagrid had never believed [he]281-hagrid would meet [a boy [he]281-hagrid hated more than [Dudley]94-dudley]1477-a boy he hated more than dudley , but that was before [he]281-hagrid met [Draco Malfoy]221-malfoy . Still , [first - year Gryffindors]1478-first - year gryffindors only had Potions with [the Slytherins]260-the slytherins , so [they]1478-first - year gryffindors did n't have to put up with [Malfoy]221-malfoy much . Or at least , [they]1478-first - year gryffindors did n't until [they]1478-first - year gryffindors spotted a notice pinned up in [the Gryffindor common room]1373-the gryffindor common room that made [them]1478-first - year gryffindors all groan . Flying lessons would be starting on Thursday -- and [Gryffindor]225-gryffindor and [Slytherin]176-slytherin would be learning together .

" Typical , "[281-hagrid] said [Harry]281-hagrid darkly . " Just what [I]281-hagrid always wanted . To make a fool of [myself]281-hagrid on a broomstick in front of [Malfoy]221-malfoy . "[281-hagrid]

[He]281-hagrid had been looking forward to learning to fly more than anything else .

" [You]281-hagrid do n't know that [you]281-hagrid 'll make a fool of [yourself]281-hagrid , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron reasonably . " Anyway , [I]191-ron know [Malfoy]221-malfoy 's always going on about how good [he]221-malfoy is at [Quidditch]173-quidditch , but [I]191-ron bet that 's all talk . "[191-ron]

[Malfay]284-malfay certainly did talk about flying a lot . [He]284-malfay complained loudly about first years never getting on [the house Quidditch teams]1480-the house quidditch teams and told long , boastful stories that always seemed to end with [him]284-malfay narrowly escaping Muggles in [helicopters]1481-helicopters . [He]284-malfay was n't the only one , though : the way [Seamus Finnigan]242-seamus told it , [he]242-seamus 'd spent most of [his]242-seamus childhood zooming around [the countryside]1167-the countryside on [his]242-seamus broomstick . Even [Ron]191-ron would tell [anyone who 'd listen about the time [he]191-ron 'd almost hit [a hang glider]1484-a hang glider on [[Charlie]201-charlie 's old broom]1485-charlie 's old broom]1483-anyone who 'd listen about the time he 'd almost hit a hang glider on charlie 's old broom . [Everyone from [wizarding families]1487-wizarding families]1486-everyone from wizarding families talked about [Quidditch]173-quidditch constantly . [Ron]191-ron had already had a big argument with [Dean Thomas]162-dean , who shared [their]1488-their dormitory , about soccer . [Ron]191-ron could n't see what was exciting about a game with only one ball where [no one]2380-no one was allowed to fly . [Harry]281-hagrid had caught [Ron]191-ron prodding [Dean]162-dean 's poster of [West Ham]55-west ham [soccer team]1490-soccer team , trying to make [the players]1491-the players move .

[Neville]194-neville had never been on a broomstick in [his]194-neville life , because [[his]194-neville grandmother]1492-his grandmother had never let [him]194-neville near one . Privately , [Harry]281-hagrid felt [she]1492-his grandmother 'd had good reason , because [Neville]194-neville managed to have an extraordinary number of accidents even with both feet on the ground .

[Hermione Granger]216-hermione was almost as nervous about flying as [Neville]194-neville was . This was something [you]1493-you could n't learn by heart out of a book -- not that [she]216-hermione had n't tried . At breakfast on Thursday [she]216-hermione bored [them]1494-them all stupid with flying tips [she]216-hermione 'd gotten out of a library book called [Quidditch]173-quidditch Through the Ages . [Neville]194-neville was hanging on to [her]216-hermione every word , desperate for anything that might help [him]194-neville hang on to [his]194-neville broomstick later , but [everybody else]1495-everybody else was very pleased when [Hermione]216-hermione 's lecture was interrupted by the arrival of the mail .

[Harry]281-hagrid had n't had a single letter since [Hagrid]281-hagrid 's note , something that [Malfoy]221-malfoy had been quick to notice , of course . [Malfoy]221-malfoy 's eagle owl was always bringing [him]194-neville packages of sweets from [home]448-home , which [he]194-neville opened gloatingly at the Slytherin table .

[A barn owl]1497-a barn owl brought [Neville]194-neville a small package from [[his]194-neville grandmother]1492-his grandmother . [He]1497-a barn owl opened it excitedly and showed [them]1499-their a glass ball the size of a large marble , which seemed to be full of white smoke .

" It 's a Remembrall ! "[1497-a barn owl] [he]1497-a barn owl explained . " [Gran]193-gran knows [I]1497-a barn owl forget things -- this tells [you]194-neville if there 's something [you]194-neville 've forgotten to do . " [You]194-neville 've forgotten something ... "[221-malfoy]

[Neville]194-neville was trying to remember what [he]194-neville 'd forgotten when [Draco Malfoy]221-malfoy , who was passing the Gryffindor table , snatched the Remembrall out of [his]194-neville hand .

[Harry]281-hagrid and [Ron]191-ron jumped to [their]1499-their feet . [They]1499-their were half hoping for a reason to fight [Malfay]284-malfay , but [Professor McGonagall]105-harry , who could spot trouble quicker than [any teacher in [the school]2544-the school]1500-any teacher in the school , was there in a flash .

" What 's going on ? "[105-harry]

" [Malfoy]221-malfoy 's got [my]221-malfoy Remembrall , [Professor]2937-professor . "[221-malfoy]

" Just looking , "[221-malfoy] [he]221-malfoy said , and [he]221-malfoy sloped away with [Crabbe]219-crabbe and [Goyle]220-goyle behind [him]221-malfoy .

At three - thirty that afternoon , [Harry]105-harry , [Ron]191-ron , and [the other Gryffindors]1502-the other gryffindors hurried down the front steps onto [the grounds]2900-the grounds for [their]1499-their first flying lesson . It was a clear , breezy day , and the grass rippled under [their]1499-their feet as [they]1499-their marched down [the sloping lawns]1504-the sloping lawns toward a smooth , flat lawn on [the opposite side of [the grounds]2900-the grounds]1505-the opposite side of the grounds to [the forbidden forest]1461-the forbidden forest , whose trees were swaying darkly in the distance .

[The Slytherins]260-the slytherins were already there , and so were twenty broomsticks lying in neat lines on the ground . [Harry]105-harry had heard [Fred]189-fred and [George Weasley]190-george complain about the school brooms , saying that some of them started to vibrate if [you]1508-you flew too high , or always flew slightly to the left .

[[Their]1499-their teacher]1509-their teacher , [Madam Hooch]266-madam hooch , arrived . [She]266-madam hooch had short , gray hair , and yellow eyes like a hawk .

" Well , what are [you]1499-their all waiting for ? "[266-madam hooch] [she]266-madam hooch barked . " [Everyone]2365-everyone stand by a broomstick . Come on , hurry up . "[266-madam hooch]

[Harry]105-harry glanced down at [his]105-harry broom . It was old and some of the twigs stuck out at odd angles .

" Stick out [your]1508-you right hand over [your]1508-you broom , "[266-madam hooch] called [Madam Hooch]266-madam hooch at the front , " and say ' Up ! "[266-madam hooch] '

" UPF [everyone]2365-everyone shouted .[266-madam hooch]

[Harry]105-harry 's broom jumped into [his]105-harry hand at once , but it was one of the few that did . [Hermione Granger]216-hermione 's had simply rolled over on the ground , and [Neville]194-neville 's had n't moved at all . Perhaps brooms , like horses , could tell when [you]1508-you were afraid , thought [Harry]105-harry ; there was a quaver in [Neville]194-neville 's voice that said only too clearly that [he]194-neville wanted to keep [his]194-neville feet on the ground .

[Madam Hooch]266-madam hooch then showed [them]1510-their how to mount [their]1510-their brooms without sliding off the end , and walked up and down the rows correcting [their]1510-their grips . [Harry]105-harry and [Ron]191-ron were delighted when [she]266-madam hooch told [Malfoy]221-malfoy [he]221-malfoy 'd been doing it wrong for years .

CHAPTER TEN

[HALLOWEEN

" Wow , "[191-ron] [Ron]191-ron sighed , as the broomstick rolled onto [[Harry]91-harry 's bedspread]1626-harry 's bedspread .

[Even Harry]91-harry , who knew nothing about the different brooms , thought it looked wonderful . Sleek and shiny , with a mahogany handle , it had a long tail of neat , straight twigs and Nimbus Two Thousand written in gold near the top .

As seven o'clock drew nearer , [Harry]91-harry left [the castle]1233-the castle and set off in the dusk toward [the Quidditch field]1613-the quidditch field . [Held]301-held never been inside [the stadium]1629-the stadium before . children]1633-muggle children blew bubbles through , except that they were fifty feet high .

Too eager to fly again to wait for [Wood]288-wood , [Harry]91-harry mounted [his]91-harry broomstick and kicked off from the ground . What a feeling -- [he]91-harry swooped in and out of the goal posts and then sped up and down [the field]1630-the field . [The Nimbus Two Thousand]300-the nimbus turned wherever [he]91-harry wanted at [his]91-harry lightest touch .

" Hey , [Potter]91-harry , come down ! '[288-wood]

[Oliver Wood]288-wood had arrived . fie was carrying a large wooden crate under [his]288-wood arm . [Harry]91-harry landed next to [him]288-wood .

" Very nice , "[288-wood] said [Wood]288-wood , [his]288-wood eyes glinting . " [I]288-wood see what [McGonagall]105-harry meant ... [you]91-harry really are [a natural]3005-a natural . [I]288-wood 'm just going to teach [you]91-harry the rules this evening , then [you]91-harry 'll be joining team practice three times a week . "[288-wood]

[He]288-wood opened the crate . Inside were four different - sized balls .

" Right , "[288-wood] said [Wood]288-wood . " Now , [Quidditch]173-quidditch is easy enough to understand , even if it 's not too easy to play . "[105-harry]

" [Pig snout]3066-pig snout , "[1707-they] [they]1707-they said and entered .

CHAPTER ELEVEN

QUIDDITCH

As [they]1707-they entered November , the weather turned very cold . [The mountains around [the school]2544-the school]1716-the mountains around the school became icy gray and [the lake]1225-the lake like chilled steel . Every morning the ground was covered in frost . [Hagrid]281-hagrid could be seen from the upstairs windows defrosting broomsticks on [the Quidditch field]1613-the quidditch field , bundled up in a long moleskin overcoat , rabbit fur gloves , and enormous beaverskin boots .

The Quidditch season had begun . On Saturday , [Harry]281-hagrid would be playing in [his]281-hagrid first match after weeks of training : [Gryffindor]225-gryffindor versus [Slytherin]292-seeker . If [Gryffindor]225-gryffindor won , [they]1707-they would move up into second place in the house championship .

Hardly [anyone]375-anyone had seen [Harry]281-hagrid play because [Wood]288-wood had decided that , as [their]1707-they secret weapon , [Harry]281-hagrid should be kept , well , secret . But the news that [he]281-hagrid was playing [Seeker]292-seeker had leaked out somehow , and [Harry]281-hagrid did n't know which was worse -- [people]2354-people telling [him]281-hagrid [he]281-hagrid 'd be brilliant or [people]2354-people telling [him]281-hagrid [they]2354-people 'd be running around underneath [him]281-hagrid holding a mattress .

It was really lucky that [Harry]281-hagrid now had [Hermlone]311-hermlone as [a friend]549-a friend . [He]281-hagrid did n't know how [he]281-hagrid 'd have gotten through all [his]281-hagrid homework without [her]311-hermlone , what with all the last - minute Quidditch practice [Wood]288-wood was making [them]1707-they do . [She]311-hermlone had also tent [him]281-hagrid [Quidditch]173-quidditch Through the Ages , which turned out to be a very interesting read .

[Harry]281-hagrid learned that there were seven hundred ways of committing a Quidditch foul and that all of them had happened during a World Cup match in 1473 ; that [Seekers]305-seekers were usually [the smallest and fastest players]1724-the smallest and fastest players , and that most serious Quidditch accidents seemed to happen to [them]305-seekers ; that although [people]2354-people rarely died playing [Quidditch]173-quidditch , [referees]1726-referees had been known to vanish and turn up months later in [the Sahara Desert]62-the sahara desert .

[Hermione]216-hermione had become a bit more relaxed about breaking rules since [Harry]281-hagrid and [Ron]191-ron had saved [her]216-hermione from the mountain troll , and [she]311-hermlone was much nicer for it . The day before [Harry]281-hagrid 's first Quidditch match the three of [them]1707-they were out in [the freezing courtyard]1727-the freezing courtyard during break , and [she]311-hermlone had conjured [them]1707-they up a bright blue fire that could be carried around in a jam jar . [They]1707-they were standing with [their]1707-they backs to it , getting warm , when [Snape]263-snape crossed [the yard]1728-the yard . [Harry]281-hagrid noticed at once that [Snape]263-snape was limping . [Harry]281-hagrid , [Ron]191-ron , and [Hermione]216-hermione moved closer together to block the fire from view ; [they]1707-they were sure it would n't be allowed . Unfortunately , something about [their]1707-they guilty faces caught [Snape]263-snape 's eye . [He]263-snape limped over . [He]263-snape had n't seen the fire , but [he]263-snape seemed to be looking for a reason to tell [them]1707-they off anyway .

" What 's that [you]263-snape 've got there , [Potter]91-harry ? "[263-snape]

It was [Quidditch]173-quidditch Through the Ages . [Harry]91-harry showed [him]263-snape .

" Library books are not to be taken outside [the school]2544-the school , "[263-snape] said [Snape]263-snape . " Give it to [me]263-snape . Five points from [Gryffindor]314-gryffindor . "[263-snape]

" [He]263-snape 's just made that rule up , "[91-harry] [Harry]91-harry muttered angrily as [Snape]263-snape limped away . " Wonder what 's wrong with [his]263-snape leg ? "[91-harry]

" Dunno , but [I]191-ron hope it 's really hurting [him]263-snape , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron bitterly .

[The Gryffindor common room]1373-the gryffindor common room was very noisy that evening . [Harry]91-harry , [Ron]191-ron , and [Hermione]216-hermione sat together next to a window . " Foul ! "[259-gryffindors] screamed [the Gryffindors]259-gryffindors .

CHAPTER TWELVE

THE MIRROR OF ERISED

Christmas was coming . One morning in mid - December , [Hogwarts]267-hoggy warty hogwarts woke to find [itself]267-hoggy warty hogwarts covered in several feet of snow . [No one]2380-no one could wait for the holidays to start . [He]281-hagrid , [Ron]191-ron , and [Hermione]216-hermione had already agreed [they]1823-they 'd better not ask [Madam Pince]327-madam pince where [they]1823-they could find [Flamel]208-dumbledore . [They]1823-they were sure [she]1821-the librarian 'd be able to tell [them]1823-they , but [they]1823-they could n't risk [Snape]263-snape hearing what [they]1823-they were up to .

[Harry]281-hagrid waited outside in [the corridor]1153-the corridor to see if [the other two]502-the other two had found anything , but [he]281-hagrid was n't very hopeful . [They]1823-they had been looking for two weeks , after A , but as [they]1823-they only had odd moments between lessons it was n't surprising [they]1823-they 'd found nothing . What [they]1823-they really needed was a nice long search without [Madam Pince]327-madam pince breathing down [their]1823-they necks .

Five minutes later , [Ron]191-ron and [Hermione]216-hermione joined [him]281-hagrid , shaking [their]1823-they heads . [They]1823-they went off to lunch .

" [You]281-hagrid will keep looking while [I]216-hermione 'm away , wo n't [you]281-hagrid ? "[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione . " And send [me]216-hermione an owl if [you]281-hagrid find anything . "[216-hermione]

" And [you]281-hagrid could ask [[your]281-hagrid parents]2417-your parents if [they]2417-your parents know who [Flamel]208-dumbledore is , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron . " It 'd be safe to ask [them]2417-your parents . "[191-ron]

" Very safe , as [they]1823-they 're [both dentists]3119-both dentists , "[216-hermione] said [Hermione]216-hermione .

Once the holidays had started , [Ron]191-ron and [Harry]281-hagrid were having too good a time to think much about [Flamel]208-dumbledore . [They]1823-they had [the dormitory]1623-the dormitory to [themselves]1823-they and [the common room]1599-the common room was far emptier than usual , so [they]1823-they were able to get the good armchairs by the fire . [They]1823-they sat by the hour eating anything [they]1823-they could spear on a toasting fork -- bread , English muffins , marshmallows -- and plotting ways of getting [Malfoy]221-malfoy expelled , which were fun to talk about even if [they]1823-they would n't work .

[Ron]191-ron also started teaching [Harry]281-hagrid wizard chess . This was exactly like Muggle chess except that the figures were alive , which made it a lot like directing [troops in battle]1828-troops in battle . [Ron]191-ron 's set was very old and battered . Like everything else [he]191-ron owned , it had once belonged to [someone else in [[his]191-ron family]2833-his family]1829-someone else in his family -- in this case , [[his]191-ron grandfather]1831-his grandfather . [Harry]281-hagrid played with chessmen [Seamus Finnigan]242-seamus had lent [him]281-hagrid , and [they]1833-they did n't trust [him]281-hagrid at all . [He]281-hagrid was n't [a very good player]1834-a very good player yet and [they]1833-they kept shouting different bits of advice at [him]281-hagrid , which was confusing . " Do n't send [me]1833-they [there]555-there , ca n't [you]1833-they see [[his]281-hagrid knight]3121-his knight ? Send [him]281-hagrid , [we]1833-they can afford to lose [him]281-hagrid . "[1833-they] On Christmas Eve , [Harry]281-hagrid went to bed looking forward to the next day for the food and the fun , but not expecting any presents at all . When [he]281-hagrid woke early in the morning , however , the first thing [he]281-hagrid saw was a small pile of packages at the foot of [his]281-hagrid bed .

" Merry Christmas , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron sleepily as [Harry]281-hagrid scrambled out of bed and pulled on [his]281-hagrid bathrobe .

" [You]281-hagrid , too , "[281-hagrid] said [Harry]281-hagrid . " Will [you]281-hagrid look at this ? [I]281-hagrid 've got some presents ! "[281-hagrid]

" What did [you]281-hagrid expect , turnips ? "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron , turning to [his]191-ron own pile , which was a lot bigger than [Harry]281-hagrid 's .

[Harry]281-hagrid picked up the top parcel . It was wrapped in thick brown paper and scrawled across it was To [Harry]281-hagrid , from [Hagrid]281-hagrid . Inside was a roughly cut wooden flute . [Hagrid]281-hagrid had obviously whittled it [himself]281-hagrid . [Harry]281-hagrid blew it -- it sounded a bit like an owl .

A second , very small parcel contained a note .

[We]1835-we received [your]1836-your message and enclose [your]1836-your Christmas present . From [Uncle Vernon]118-uncle vernon and [Aunt Petunia]102-aunt petunia . Taped to the note was a fifty - pence piece .

" That 's friendly , "[281-hagrid] said [Harry]281-hagrid .

[Ron]191-ron was fascinated by the fifty pence .

" Weird ! "[191-ron] [he]191-ron said , ' NMat a shape ! This is money ? "[191-ron]

" [I]191-ron think [I]191-ron know who [that one]2996-that one 's from , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron , turning a bit pink and pointing to a very lumpy parcel . " [[My]191-ron mom]2495-my mom . "[191-ron]

[Harry]281-hagrid had torn open the parcel to find a thick , hand - knitted sweater in emerald green and a large box of homemade fudge .

" Every year [she]2495-my mom makes [us]3126-us a sweater , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron , unwrapping [his]191-ron own , " and [mine]191-ron 's always maroon . "[191-ron]

" That 's really nice of [her]2495-my mom , "[281-hagrid] said [Harry]281-hagrid , trying the fudge , which was very tasty .

[His]281-hagrid next present also contained candy -- a large box of Chocolate Frogs from [Hermione]216-hermione .

This only left one parcel . [Harry]281-hagrid picked it up and felt it . It was very light . [He]281-hagrid unwrapped it .

Something fluid and silvery gray went slithering to the floor where it lay in gleaming folds . [Ron]191-ron gasped .

" [I]191-ron 've heard of those , "[191-ron] [he]191-ron said in a hushed voice , dropping the box of Every Flavor Beans [he]191-ron 'd gotten from [Hermione]216-hermione . " If that 's what [I]191-ron think it is -- they 're really rare , and really valuable . "[191-ron]

" What is it ? "[191-ron]

[Harry]281-hagrid picked the shining , silvery cloth off the floor . It was strange to the touch , like water woven into material .

" It 's an invisibility cloak , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron , a look of awe on [his]191-ron face . " [I]191-ron 'm sure it is -- try it on . "[191-ron]

[Harry]281-hagrid threw the cloak around [his]281-hagrid shoulders and [Ron]191-ron gave a yell .

" It is ! Look down ! "[191-ron]

[Harry]281-hagrid looked down at [his]281-hagrid feet , but they were gone . [He]281-hagrid dashed to the mirror . Sure enough , [his]281-hagrid reflection looked back at [him]281-hagrid , just [his]281-hagrid head suspended in midair , [his]281-hagrid body completely invisible . [He]281-hagrid pulled the cloak over [his]281-hagrid head and [his]281-hagrid reflection vanished completely .

" There 's a note ! "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron suddenly . " A note fell out of it ! "[191-ron]

[Harry]281-hagrid pulled off the cloak and seized the letter . Written in narrow , loopy writing [he]281-hagrid had never seen before were the following words : [[Your]281-hagrid father]2696-your father left this in [my]0-i possession before [he]2696-your father died . A Very Merry Christmas to [you]281-hagrid .

There was no signature . [Harry]281-hagrid stared at the note . [Ron]191-ron was admiring the cloak .

" [I]191-ron 'd give anything for one of these , "[191-ron] [he]191-ron said . " Anything . What 's the matter ? "[191-ron]

" Nothing , "[281-hagrid] said [Harry]281-hagrid . [He]281-hagrid felt very strange . Who had sent the cloak ? Had it really once belonged to [[his]281-hagrid father]523-his father ?

[Harry]281-hagrid had never in all [his]281-hagrid life had such a Christmas dinner . A hundred fat , roast turkeys ; mountains of roast and boiled potatoes ; platters of chipolatas ; tureens of buttered peas , silver boats of thick , rich gravy and cranberry sauce -- and stacks of wizard crackers every few feet along the table . These fantastic party favors were nothing like the feeble Muggle ones [the Dursleys]93-the dursleys usually bought , with [their]93-the dursleys little plastic toys and [their]93-the dursleys flimsy paper hats inside . [Harry]281-hagrid pulled a wizard cracker with [Fred]189-fred and it did n't just bang , it went off with a blast like a cannon and engulfed [them]1840-they all in a cloud of blue smoke , while from the inside exploded a [rear admiral]1842-rear admiral 's hat and several live , white mice . Up at [the High Table]69-the high table , [Dumbledore]208-dumbledore had swapped [his]208-dumbledore pointed wizard 's hat for a flowered bonnet , and was chuckling merrily at a joke [Professor Flitwick]278-professor flitwick had just read [him]208-dumbledore .

Flaming Christmas puddings followed the turkey . [Percy]188-percy nearly broke [his]188-percy teeth on a silver sickle embedded in [his]188-percy slice . [Harry]281-hagrid watched [Hagrid]281-hagrid getting redder and redder in the face as [he]281-hagrid called for more wine , finally kissing [Professor McGonagall]105-harry on the cheek , who , to [Harry]105-harry 's amazement , giggled and blushed , [her]1843-her top hat lopsided .

When [Harry]105-harry finally left the table , [he]105-harry was laden down with a stack of things out of the crackers , including a pack of nonexplodable , luminous balloons , a Grow - [Your]1844-your - Own - Warts kit , and [his]105-harry own new wizard chess set . [The white mice]1845-the white mice had disappeared and [Harry]105-harry had a nasty feeling [they]1845-the white mice were going to end up as [Mrs. Norris]273-mrs. norris 's Christmas dinner .

[Harry]105-harry and [the Weasleys]199-the weasleys spent a happy afternoon having a furious snowball fight on [the grounds]2900-the grounds . Then , cold , wet , and gasping for breath , [they]1847-they returned to the fire in [the Gryffindor common room]1373-the gryffindor common room , where [Harry]105-harry broke in [his]105-harry new chess set by losing spectacularly to [Ron]191-ron . [He]105-harry suspected [he]105-harry would n't have lost so badly if [Percy]188-percy had n't tried to help [him]105-harry so much .

After a meal of turkey sandwiches , crumpets , trifle , and Christmas cake , [everyone]2365-everyone felt too full and sleepy to do much before bed except sit and watch [Percy]188-percy chase [Fred]189-fred and [George]190-george all over [Gryffindor tower]52-gryffindor tower because [they]1847-they 'd stolen [his]105-harry prefect badge .

It had been [Harry]105-harry 's best Christmas day ever . Yet something had been nagging at the back of [his]105-harry mind all day . Not until [he]105-harry climbed into bed was [he]105-harry free to think about it : the invisibility cloak and whoever had sent it .

[Ron]191-ron , full of turkey and cake and with nothing mysterious to bother [him]191-ron , fell asleep almost as soon as [he]191-ron 'd drawn the curtains of [his]191-ron four - poster . [Harry]105-harry leaned over the side of [his]105-harry own bed and pulled the cloak out from under it .

[[His]105-harry father]523-his father 's ... this had been [[his]105-harry father]523-his father 's . [He]105-harry let the material flow over [his]105-harry hands , smoother than silk , light as air . Use it well , the note had said .

[He]105-harry had to try it , now . [He]105-harry slipped out of bed and wrapped the cloak around [himself]105-harry . Looking down at [his]105-harry legs , [he]105-harry saw only moonlight and shadows . It was a very funny feeling .

Use it well .

Suddenly , [Harry]105-harry felt wide - awake . [The whole of [Hogwarts]20-hogwarts]1852-the whole of hogwarts was open to [him]105-harry in this cloak . Excitement flooded through [him]105-harry as [he]105-harry stood there in the dark and silence . [He]105-harry could go anywhere in this , anywhere , and [Filch]272-filch would never know .

[Ron]191-ron grunted in [his]191-ron sleep . Should [Harry]105-harry wake [him]191-ron ? Something held [him]105-harry back -- [[his]105-harry father]523-his father 's cloak -- [he]105-harry felt that this time -- the first time -- [he]105-harry wanted to use it alone .

[He]105-harry crept out of [the dormitory]1623-the dormitory , down the stairs , across [the common room]1599-the common room , and climbed through the portrait hole .

" Who 's there ? "[1559-the fat lady] squawked [the Fat Lady]1559-the fat lady . [Harry]105-harry said nothing . [He]105-harry walked quickly down [the corridor]1153-the corridor .

Where should [he]105-harry go ? [He]105-harry stopped , [his]105-harry heart racing , and thought . And then it came to [him]105-harry . [The Restricted Section in [the library]672-the library]1858-the restricted section in the library . [He]105-harry 'd be able to read as long as [he]105-harry liked , as long as it took to find out who [Flamel]208-dumbledore was . [He]105-harry set off , drawing the invisibility cloak tight around [him]105-harry as [he]105-harry walked .

[The library]672-the library was pitch - black and very eerie . [Harry]105-harry lit a lamp to see [his]105-harry way along the rows of books . The lamp looked as if it was floating along in midair , and even though [Harry]105-harry could feel [his]105-harry arm supporting it , the sight gave [him]105-harry the creeps .

[The Restricted Section]1816-the restricted section was right at the back of [the library]672-the library . Step ping carefully over the rope that separated these books from the rest of [the library]672-the library , [he]105-harry held up [his]105-harry lamp to read the titles .

[They]1864-they did n't tell [him]105-harry much . [Their]1864-they peeling , faded gold letters spelled words in languages [Harry]105-harry could n't understand . [Some]2536-some had no title at all . One book had a dark stain on it that looked horribly like blood . The hairs on the back of [Harry]105-harry 's neck prickled . Maybe [he]105-harry was imagining it , maybe not , but [he]105-harry thought a faint whispering was coming from the books , as though [they]1864-they knew [someone]713-someone was there who should n't be .

[He]105-harry had to start somewhere . Setting the lamp down carefully on the floor , [he]105-harry looked along the bottom shelf for an interestinglooking book . A large black and silver volume caught [his]105-harry eye . [He]105-harry pulled it out with difficulty , because it was very heavy , and , balancing it on [his]105-harry knee , let it fall open .

A piercing , bloodcurdling shriek split the silence -- the book was screaming ! [Harry]105-harry snapped it shut , but the shriek went on and on , one high , unbroken , earsplitting note . [He]105-harry stumbled backward and knocked over [his]105-harry lamp , which went out at once . Panicking , [he]105-harry heard footsteps coming down [the corridor outside]1867-the corridor outside -- stuffing the shrieking book back on the shelf , [he]105-harry ran for it . [He]105-harry passed [Filch]272-filch in the doorway ; [Filch]272-filch 's pale , wild eyes looked straight through [him]105-harry , and [Harry]105-harry slipped under [Filch]272-filch 's outstretched arm and streaked off up [the corridor]1153-the corridor , the book 's shrieks still ringing in [his]105-harry ears .

[He]105-harry came to a sudden halt in front of a tall suit of armor . [He]105-harry had been so busy getting away from [the library]672-the library , [he]105-harry had n't paid attention to where [he]105-harry was going . Perhaps because it was dark , [he]105-harry did n't recognize where [he]105-harry was at all . There was a suit of armor near [the kitchens]1870-the kitchens , [he]105-harry knew , but [he]105-harry must be five floors above there .

" [You]105-harry asked [me]105-harry to come directly to [you]105-harry , [Professor]2937-professor , if [anyone]375-anyone was wandering around at night , and [somebody]374-somebody 's been in [the library Restricted Section]3138-the library restricted section . "[105-harry]

[Harry]105-harry felt the blood drain out of [his]105-harry face . [Harry]105-harry stood rooted to the spot as [Filch]272-filch and [Snape]263-snape came around the corner ahead . [They]1871-they could n't see [him]105-harry , of course , but it was [a narrow corridor]1872-a narrow corridor and if [they]1871-they came much nearer [they]1871-they 'd knock right into [him]105-harry -- the cloak did n't stop [him]105-harry from being solid .

[He]105-harry backed away as quietly as [he]105-harry could . A door stood ajar to [his]105-harry left . It was [his]105-harry only hope . [He]105-harry squeezed through it , holding [his]105-harry breath , trying not to move it , and to [his]105-harry relief [he]105-harry managed to get inside [the room]525-the room without [their]1871-they noticing anything . [They]1871-they walked straight past , and [Harry]105-harry leaned against the wall , breathing deeply , listening to [their]1871-they footsteps dying away . That had been close , very close . It was a few seconds before [he]105-harry noticed anything about [the room]525-the room [he]105-harry had hidden in .

[It]525-the room looked like [an unused classroom]1875-an unused classroom . The dark shapes of desks and chairs were piled against the walls , and there was an upturned wastepaper basket -- but propped against the wall facing [him]105-harry was something that did n't look as if it belonged there , something that looked as if [someone had just put it there]1876-someone had just put it there to keep it out of the way .

It was a magnificent mirror , as high as the ceiling , with an ornate gold frame , standing on two clawed feet . There was an inscription carved around the top : Erised stra ehru oyt ube cafru oyt on wohsi . [His]105-harry panic fading now that there was no sound of [Filch]272-filch and Snape , [Harry]105-harry moved nearer to the mirror , wanting to look at [himself]105-harry but see no reflection again . [He]105-harry stepped in front of it .

[He]105-harry had to clap [his]105-harry hands to [his]105-harry mouth to stop [himself]105-harry from screaming . [He]105-harry whirled around . [His]105-harry heart was pounding far more furiously than when the book had screamed -- for [he]105-harry had seen not only [himself]105-harry in the mirror , but [a whole crowd of people]1877-a whole crowd of people standing right behind [him]105-harry .

But [the room]525-the room was empty . Breathing very fast , [he]105-harry turned slowly back to the mirror .

There [he]105-harry was , reflected in it , white and scared - looking , and there , reflected behind [him]105-harry , were at least [ten others]1879-ten others . [Harry]105-harry looked over [his]105-harry shoulder -- but still , [no one]2380-no one was there . Or were [they]1879-ten others all invisible , too ? Was [he]105-harry in fact in [a room full of [invisible people]1882-invisible people]1881-a room full of invisible people and this mirror 's trick was that it reflected [them]1879-ten others , invisible or not ?

[He]105-harry looked in the mirror again . [A woman standing right behind [his]105-harry reflection]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection was smiling at [him]105-harry and waving . [He]105-harry reached out a hand and felt the air behind [him]105-harry . If [she]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection was really there , [he]105-harry 'd touch [her]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection , [their]1884-their reflections were so close together , but [he]105-harry felt only air -- [she]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection and the others existed only in the mirror .

[She]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection was [a very pretty woman]1885-a very pretty woman . [She]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection had dark red hair and [her]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection eyes -- [her]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection eyes are just like [mine]105-harry , [Harry]105-harry thought , edging a little closer to the glass . Bright green -- exactly the same shape , but then [he]105-harry noticed that [she]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection was crying ; smiling , but crying at the same time . [The tall , thin , black - haired man standing next to]1886-the tall , thin , black - haired man standing next to [her]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection put [his]1886-the tall , thin , black - haired man standing next to arm around [her]1883-a woman standing right behind his reflection . [He]1886-the tall , thin , black - haired man standing next to wore glasses , and [his]1886-the tall , thin , black - haired man standing next to hair was very untidy . It stuck up at the back , just as [Harry]105-harry 's did .

[Harry]105-harry was so close to the mirror now that [his]105-harry nose was nearly touching that of [his]105-harry reflection .

" [Mom]196-mom ? "[105-harry] [he]105-harry whispered . " [Dad]138-dad ? "[105-harry]

[They]1887-they just looked at [him]105-harry , smiling . CHAPTER THIRTEEN

[NICOLAS FLAMEL

Dumbledore]208-dumbledore had convinced [Harry]281-hagrid not to go looking for [the Mirror of [Erised]71-erised]1913-the mirror of erised again , and for the rest of the Christmas holidays the invisibility cloak stayed folded at the bottom of [his]281-hagrid trunk . [Harry]281-hagrid wished [he]281-hagrid could forget what [he]281-hagrid 'd seen in the mirror as easily , but [he]281-hagrid could n't . [He]281-hagrid started having nightmares . Over and over again [he]281-hagrid dreamed about [[his]281-hagrid parents]548-his parents disappearing in a flash of green light , while a high voice cackled with laughter .

" [You]281-hagrid see , [Dumbledore]208-dumbledore was right , that mirror could drive [you]281-hagrid mad , "[191-ron] said [Ron]191-ron , when [Harry]281-hagrid told [him]191-ron about [these drearns]1915-these drearns .

[They]1917-they had almost given up hope of ever finding [Flamel]208-dumbledore in a li- brary book , even though [Harry]281-hagrid was still sure [he]281-hagrid 'd read the name somewhere . [Harry]281-hagrid had even less time than the other two , because [Quidditch]173-quidditch practice had started again .

[Wood]314-gryffindor was working [the team]2962-the team harder than ever . Even the endless rain that had replaced the snow could n't dampen [his]314-gryffindor spirits . "[194-neville]

[Hermione]216-hermione jumped to [her]216-hermione feet . [She]216-hermione had n't looked so excited since [they]1932-they 'd gotten back the marks for [their]1932-they very first piece of homework .

" Stay there ! "[216-hermione] [she]216-hermione said , and [she]216-hermione sprinted up [the stairs]1621-the stairs to [[the girls]1375-the girls ' dormitories]1935-the girls ' dormitories . CHAPTER FOURTEEN

[NORBERT THE NORWEGIAN RIDGEBACK

Quirrell]334-norbert , however , must have been braver than [they]1975-they 'd thought . In the weeks that followed [he]334-norbert did seem to be getting paler and thinner , but it did n't look as though [he]334-norbert 'd cracked yet .

Every time [they]1975-they passed [the third - floor corridor]1976-the third - floor corridor , [Harry]281-hagrid , [Ron]191-ron , and [Hermione]216-hermione would press [their]1975-they ears to the door to check that [Fluffy]325-fluffy was still growling inside . [Snape]263-snape was sweeping about in [his]263-snape usual bad temper , which surely meant that [the Stone]89-the stone was still safe . Whenever [Harry]281-hagrid passed [Quirrell]334-norbert these days [he]281-hagrid gave [him]281-hagrid an encouraging sort of smile , and [Ron]191-ron had started telling [people]2354-people off for laughing at [Quirrell]334-norbert 's stutter .

[Hermione]216-hermione , however , had more on [her]216-hermione mind than [the Sorcerer]336-sorcerer 's Stone . [She]216-hermione had started drawing up study schedules and colorcoding all [her]216-hermione notes . [Harry]281-hagrid and [Ron]191-ron would n't have minded , but [she]216-hermione kept nagging [them]1975-they to do the same .

" [Hermione]216-hermione , the exams are ages away . "[216-hermione]

" Ten weeks , "[216-hermione] [Hermione]216-hermione snapped . " That 's not ages , that 's like a second to [Nicolas Flamel]208-dumbledore . "[216-hermione]

" But [we]3210-we 're not six hundred years old , "[191-ron] [Ron]191-ron reminded [her]216-hermione . " Anyway , what are [you]216-hermione studying for , [you]216-hermione already know it A. "[191-ron]

" What am [I]216-hermione studying for ? Are [you]216-hermione crazy ? [You]216-hermione realize [we]3210-we need to pass these exams to get into the second year ? They 're very important , [I]216-hermione should have started studying a month ago , [I]216-hermione do n't know what 's gotten into [me]216-hermione .... "[216-hermione]

Unfortunately , [the teachers]663-the teachers seemed to be thinking along the same lines as [Hermione]216-hermione . [They]663-the teachers piled so much homework on [them]663-the teachers that the Easter holidays were n't nearly as much fun as the Christmas ones . It was hard to relax with [Hermione]216-hermione next to [you]1979-you reciting the twelve uses of dragon 's blood or practicing wand movements . Moaning and yawning , [Harry]281-hagrid and [Ron]191-ron spent most of [their]1980-yeh free time in [the library]672-the library with [her]216-hermione , trying to get through all [their]1980-yeh extra work .

" [I]191-ron 'll never remember this , "[191-ron] [Ron]191-ron burst out one afternoon , throwing down [his]191-ron quill and looking longingly out of [the library]672-the library window . It was the first really fine day [they]1980-yeh 'd had in months . The sky was a clear , forget - [me]0-i - not blue , and there was a feeling in the air of summer coming .

[Harry]281-hagrid , who was looking up " Dittany "[281-hagrid] in One Thousand Magical Herbs and Fungi , did n't look up until [he]281-hagrid heard [Ron]191-ron say , " [Hagrid]281-hagrid ! What are [you]281-hagrid doing in [the library]672-the library ? "[191-ron]

" [I]281-hagrid wo n't let [you]2026-they in , "[281-hagrid] [he]281-hagrid puffed . " [Norbert]334-norbert 's at a tricky stage -- nothin' [I]281-hagrid ca n't handle . "[281-hagrid]

" Aargh ! It 's all right , [he]334-norbert only got [my]334-norbert boot -- jus ' playin ' -- [he]334-norbert 's only [a baby]521-a baby , after all . "[334-norbert]

[The baby]2027-the baby banged its tail on the wall , making the windows rattle . [Harry]281-hagrid and [Hermione]216-hermione walked back to [the castle]1233-the castle feeling Saturday could n't come quickly enough .

CHAPTER FIFTEEN

[THE FORIBIDDEN FOREST]83-the foribidden forest

"[265-filch]

CHAPTER SIXTEEN

THROUGH THE TRAPDOOR

In years to come , [Harry]105-harry would never quite remember how [he]105-harry had managed to get through [his]105-harry exams when [he]105-harry half expected [Voldemort]109-voldemort to come bursting through the door at any moment . Yet the days crept by , and there could be no doubt that [Fluffy]325-fluffy was still alive and well behind the locked door .

It was sweltering hot , especially in [the large classroom where [they]2150-they did [their]2150-they written papers]2151-the large classroom where they did their written papers . [They]2150-they had been given special , new quills for the exams , which had been bewitched with an AntiCheating spell .

[They]2150-they had practical exams as well . [Professor Flitwick]278-professor flitwick called [them]2150-they one by one into [[his]278-professor flitwick class]539-his class to see if [they]2150-they could make a pineapple tapdance across a desk . [Professor McGonagall]105-harry watched [them]2150-they turn a mouse into a snuffbox -- points were given for how pretty the snuffbox was , but taken away if it had whiskers . [Snape]263-snape made [them]2150-they all nervous , breathing down [their]2150-they necks while [they]2150-they tried to remember how to make a Forgetfulness potion .

[Harry]105-harry did the best [he]105-harry could , trying to ignore the stabbing pains in [his]105-harry forehead , which had been bothering [him]105-harry ever since [his]105-harry trip into [the forest]2899-the forest . [Neville]194-neville thought [Harry]105-harry had a bad case of exam nerves because [Harry]105-harry could n't sleep , but the truth was that [Harry]105-harry kept being woken by [his]105-harry old nightmare , except that it was now worse than ever because there was a hooded figure dripping blood in it .

Maybe it was because [they]2150-they had n't seen what [Harry]105-harry had seen in [the forest]2899-the forest , or because [they]2150-they did n't have scars burning on [their]2150-they foreheads , but [Ron]191-ron and [Hermione]216-hermione did n't seem as worried about the Stone as [Harry]105-harry . The idea of [Voldemort]109-voldemort certainly scared [them]2150-they , but [he]109-voldemort did n't keep visiting [them]2150-they in dreams , and [they]2150-they were so busy with [their]2150-they studying [they]2150-they did n't have much time to fret about what [Snape]263-snape or anyone else might be up to .

[Their]2150-they very last exam was History of Magic . One hour of answering questions about [batty old wizards who 'd invented selfstirring cauldrons]2155-batty old wizards who 'd invented selfstirring cauldrons and [they]2155-batty old wizards who 'd invented selfstirring cauldrons 'd be free , free for a whole wonderful week until [their]2150-they exam results came out . "[191-ron]

[Harry]105-harry was rubbing [his]105-harry forehead .

CHAPTER SEVENTEEN

THE MAN WITH TWO FACES

It was [Quirrell]334-norbert .

" [You]334-norbert ! "[105-harry] gasped [Harry]105-harry .

[Quirrell]334-norbert smiled . [His]334-norbert face was n't twitching at all .

" [Me]334-norbert , "[334-norbert] [he]334-norbert said calmly . " [I]334-norbert wondered whether [I]334-norbert 'd be meeting [you]105-harry here , [Potter]91-harry . "[334-norbert]

" But [I]334-norbert thought -- [Snape]263-snape -- "[334-norbert]

" [Severus]263-snape ? "[334-norbert] [Quirrell]334-norbert laughed , and it was n't [his]334-norbert usual quivering treble , either , but cold and sharp . " Yes , [Severus]263-snape does seem the type , does n't [he]263-snape ? So useful to have [him]263-snape swooping around like an overgrown bat . Next to [him]263-snape , who would suspect p - p - poor , st - stuttering [P - Professor Quirrell]165-quirrell ? "[334-norbert]

[Harry]91-harry could n't take it in . This could n't be true , it could n't .

" But [Snape]263-snape tried to kill [me]334-norbert ! "[334-norbert]

" No , no , no . [I]334-norbert tried to kill [you]91-harry . [[Your]91-harry friend]2426-your friend [Miss Granger]216-hermione accidentally knocked [me]334-norbert over as [she]216-hermione rushed to set fire to [Snape]263-snape at that Quidditch match . [She]216-hermione broke [my]334-norbert eye contact with [you]91-harry . Another few seconds and [I]334-norbert 'd have got [you]91-harry off that broom . [I]334-norbert 'd have managed it before then if [Snape]263-snape had n't been muttering a countercurse , trying to save [you]91-harry . "[334-norbert]

" [Snape]263-snape was trying to save [me]334-norbert ? "[334-norbert]

" Of course , "[165-quirrell] said [Quirrell]165-quirrell coolly . " \Why do [you]91-harry think [he]263-snape wanted to referee [your]91-harry next match ? [He]263-snape was trying to make sure [I]165-quirrell did n't do it again . Funny , really ... [he]263-snape need n't have bothered . [I]165-quirrell could n't do anything with [Dumbledore]114-dumbledore watching . [All the other teachers]3406-all the other teachers thought [Snape]263-snape was trying to stop [Gryffindor]314-gryffindor from winning , [he]263-snape did make [himself]263-snape unpopular ... and what a waste of time , when after all that , [I]165-quirrell 'm going to kill [you]91-harry tonight . "[165-quirrell]

[Quirrell]165-quirrell snapped [his]165-quirrell fingers . Ropes sprang out of thin air and wrapped themselves tightly around [Harry]91-harry .
